title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: IGNIA is a venture capital investment firm that supports the founding and expansion of high growth social enterprises that serve the base of the socio-economic pyramid (BoP) in Latin America. IGNIA's social investment focus is to fight poverty by developing profitable, highly scalable businesses that serve the needs of the Base of the Pyramid population in areas of exceptional need including health, housing, and education. These businesses provide services and products that ultimately improve the quality of life of the BoP and enable them to generate wealth for themselves. The B Corp certification provides a standard, credible means for investors and partners to recognize IGNIA's commitment not only to deliver substantial social change in our core business of investing in the BoP, but also in how we treat our employees, environment, and stakeholders.The Change We Seek™ By providing effective responses to the enormously underserved needs of low income populations, both as consumers as well as active participants in productive value chains, IGNIA empowers entrepreneurship and generates social impact while creating attractive financial returns for its investors. The largest market in Latin America is comprised of people who earn less than US$3,000 per year. These 360 million people represent the BoP market, which, in aggregate, is estimated at US$510 Billion. By providing capital to businesses in this marketplace, we enrich the community to higher standards of living while at the same time using this goal to attract investors and create a profitable return. IGNIA believes that the only way to address the poverty disparity in the BoP and tap into the aggregate market presence is through business. This is not achieved through one firm, but through the creation of an industry, which is the natural outgrowth of an economic activity which generates levels of profitability equal or higher than those with the same risk profile. IGNIA is jump-starting this industry and opening the door for other sources of capital to support impoverished regions of Mexico.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: ES Global is an international corporate social responsibility and sustainability consulting firm specializing in transitional, emerging and developing countries (TED). They are driven by a passionate commitment to helping clients achieve profitable and sustainable businesses. ES Global's approach is simple: they offer a Total Customer Solution with fully customized services that suit every one of their clients. ES Global provides practical tools for sustainable business, from comprehensive sustainability strategic planning to services that integrate sustainability practices into the core business and operations of clients. They also provide training and facilitation tools, like the internationally recognized Global Reporting Initiative (GRI), Engage Stakeholder System, Big Foot Economic Footprint and CSR Band Value. Es Global Consulting believes socially and environmentally responsible products, services, processes and practices offer enormous opportunities for the sustainably-minded firm. It is their mission to help companies profitably realize on these opportunities and to create a world where sustainable and profitable is synonymous in companies large and small.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Echale a Tu Casa is a social housing production company that delivers affordable homes to communities through the implementation of innovations in construction, technology and finance. Echale a Tu Casa’s model aims to restructure community social networking and cure the flaws inherent in the self-building process through four pillars: Organization and Social Inclusion,Financial Education and access to Social Finance Trust,Training and Technology Appropriation,Program replication through Social Impact Franchise. Echale’s sustainable housing model brings a systemic solution for the selfbuilder families. Becoming a B Corp certifies that that both the economic and social values of our model are part of our mission and rates our effectiveness in accomplishing them. The Change We Seek In spite of unprecedented economic and demographic growth over the past several years, many developing nations are confronted with the perpetual problem of housing. Today there is a total housing deficit of over 400 million around the world. In order to cope with a flawed housing delivery system, most families construct their own homes magnifying the problem since materials are inherently expensive and financing for this segment of the market is limited. Thus, housing fails to fulfill its basic economic function of building household wealth and falls short in its social function. Echale Tu Casa seeks to revert this vicious cycle by correcting the flaws inherent to the self-build process, thus allowing it to deliver returns on economic, social, and environmental levels. Through Echale’s innovative model, families can build their own home becoming proprietors of a patrimony that they can count on and inherit to the next generation. Securing a house provides families, and entire communities, the opportunity to focus on their development and househols wealth

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Ouro Verde Amazonia Ouro Verde Amazonia is a company created in 2002 by young entrepreneurs in the heart of the Amazon region. Originally built over two strong pillars (a new model of fair relationship with its suppliers – native Amazon communities – and strong investment in R&D to create added value and high nutritional value products made with native Amazon Fruits - mainly Brazil Nut and Açai Berry), The company, now is part of Grupo Orsa, promotes regional development through the sustainable use of natural resources. Based on fair commerce practices and training programs for gathering, storage and sale of raw Amazonian Fruits, our company was an innovator in developing an equitable and harmonious relationship with the indigenous communities, family farmers and rubber collectors. Thanks to its practices, Ouro Verde Amazonia earned organic certification for the entire product line from Ecocert Brasil. Over its nine years of existence, the company has consolidated a business model that stood out for its distinctive relationship with the traditional communities of the Amazon, including several indigenous ethnic groups, residents of several Resex (Federal Extractive Reserves) and smallholder farmers. This unique model was guided by the fair-trade and above-average prices paid to suppliers. In Brazil, the extraction of Brazil Nut is characterized by high concentration of production in a few states; the Acre, Amazonas and Pará hold 80.7% of production. Other states (Rondonia, Mato Grosso, Amapa and Roraima) must share the remaining 19.3%. The Northern Region is responsible for 98.72% of national production of Brazil nut, with direct impacts on the lives of extractive communities, small farmers and indigenous people. Through fair trade and ethical practices, Ouro Verde seeks to create more positive impacts in these communities, as well as for consumers. We believe in a new business model in which sharing benefits, ethical approach and solidarity are the strong bases that should support these “new generation companies.” The ending and fair financial result, which is essential for the longevity of the companies, should be an obvious and necessary result of this equation. By becoming a B Corp, we would like to share these principles with other “sister companies” around the world, learn alternative ways to reinforce these kind of principles, and add an additional water drop to the B Corporations Initiatives by sharing our history .The Change We Seek Ouro Verde Amazonia believes that one of the biggest challenges for the future of the Amazon region is to reorder old regional supply chains of its native products, like Açai Berry and Brazil Nut. These supply chains are historically characterized as unbalanced and unfair; by consolidating them in a new business model, they can be made more sustainable and harmonious by sharing the benefits of producing some of the healthiest nature foods with the native Amazonian communities. Implementation of this sustainable business model would generate at least three clear benefits: better life for local Amazon communities, maintenance of the majestic Amazon Forest (no deforestation) and widespread supply of highly healthy food (Açai and Brazil Nut) for consumers around the world. For Ouro Verde, and for all those interested in preserving the world’s largest tropical forest, production of goods made from the Brazil nut is a question of believing in a better future. The mission is to combine economic satisfaction with environmental protection, emphasizing a profound respect for nature and generating opportunities for all suppliers, employees and consumers through the practice of fair trade, ethical values and high quality services.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: CDI Ventures is a social enterprise created by CDI to use technology to empower low income communities through social businesses. The first social venture initiative is CDI Lan, which affiliates cybercafes to work in partnership as a channel to distribute products and services focused on education and financial inclusion. Nowadays, there are 6,500 of cybercafes members and CDI Lan provides training, income generation and empowerment to these micro and small entrepreneurs through a gamified platform. We became B Corp to join and contribute to a group of organizations committed to create, develop, implement and promote change for a more equal, sustainable and better world.The Change We Seek CDI was created in 1995 with the mission to democratize the access to Information Technology and Communications. After 17 years, 1.5 million people learned IT and citizenship through 717 communities centers in 12 countries. Now, through social businesses, CDI Ventures seek to transform lives by empowering small and micro entrepreneurs in low income communities using technology focusing on education and financial inclusion. People educated, informed, empowered by financial and technological tools are ready to act as changemakers and promote the change in scalable and impactful mode.

They seek to promote a fairer and more equitable economy, and to date, they have donated more than one million dollars to 120 foundations that support different social causes. All this, having less than 1% of the market share. They currently sell bottled water, biodegradable and cruelty free cleaning products, and plastic-free tissue paper.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Lumni is a new kind of financial services company dedicated to ensuring that students everywhere can leverage their most valuable asset - their own future potential - to access financing for college. Unlike traditional student lenders, they fundamentally align the interest of their investors and students in a win-win relationship that benefits everyone. Lumni's investment funds don't make loans. Instead, students commit a fixed percentage of income for the 10 years after they graduate. This dramatically reduces the risk of unmanageable payments after graduation in the case of unemployment or underemployment, giving debt-averse, underserved college students the comfort to take a leap. Lumni also employs an innovative underwriting process, determining creditworthiness not on access to co-signer like traditional lenders, but instead on a student's personal drive and potential. This allows Lumni to identify qualified clients from with the country's most underserved populations, students who would be deemed too risky by private lenders. Finally, Lumni distinguishes itself by building a relationship with its students and supporting them with career coaching and development services.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Laudex is a Mexican student-lending business that supports bottom of the pyramid to middle-income individuals reach and accomplish university or graduate studies. All of Laudex loans are structured to optimize the student’s repayment capability, both during studies and after graduation. The requirements, credit analysis and legal documents of all of our products are designed to assure a solid portfolio and an economically sustainable business model. We decided to become a B-Corp because we believe that Mexico’s future rests upon its youth education, a skilled populace is vital to overcome poverty. Beyond any doubt education plays a pivotal role in the development and progress of any country. Laudex differs from other student-loan business by offering students and their families, college loans based on flexible tuition schemes with minimum monthly payments. By 2025, it is projected that Laudex would have supported more than 8,000 young students in Mexico accomplish university or graduate studies. The Change We Seek® Laudex provides loans to university and graduate students so they may obtain a quality higher education regardless of their economic background. Mexico’s university enrollment, at roughly 28%, is at an unacceptably low level due to very limited public university capacity and a disproportionate un-affordability of quality private universities. Through student financing, Laudex is contributing to bridge this critical economic gap and create higher educational opportunities for young Mexicans.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Latitud 90 is a tour operator with the mission to generate positive experiences with people. The aim is to give each client the opportunity of learning and entertainment through traveling and participating in educational outdoor programs. With more than 13 years of experience, Latitud 90 specializes in educational outdoor programs, study tours, incentives, consulting, inbound tourism and the administration of camping sites. We became a B Corp because we are a company that has always been concerned with enchanting clients with the natural medium of our programs. We encourage our clients to take care of the environment and use their fascination with nature and outdoor activities to motivate them. In our social programs we support children with few resources and try to give them unique outdoor experiences. We believe that our outdoor activities teach values that our society needs, such as: trust, respect, solidarity, happiness, motivation, empathy. Our healthy working environment and our motivated and committed team makes up the key to our success. Latitud 90 believes that travel is a learning experience which transforms people. This is why each of their programs has been developed with the aim of revealing places, people and history in the most profound and comfortable way, always focusing on preserving the environment and creating a rewarding social setting. They are always looking for new tools to offer sustainable tourism and show the diversity and uniqueness of Chile, its contrasts, its fascinating and remote landscapes. At the same time Latitud 90 fulfills the most demanding wishes of travelers to use educational experiences so they can explore with all their senses. The Change We Seek® The activities that Latitud 90 offers promote values that society seeks. With healthy entertainment, love for nature, and fascination with outdoor activities, they encourage our clients to take care of the environment and to enjoy the richness of nature without leaving a trace.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Bicicleta Gestión de Desarrollo was born before the question about development, questioning the prevailing model that prefers economic success above social, cultural, individual and environmental success, which demands working for a fair and sustainable development. That’s how La Bicicleta was legally constituted in April, 2012, seeking a new way to be an enterprise centered on people’s dignity. We became a B Corp because we wish to be the best enterprise for the world instead of being the best of the world, by changing the way of doing business, to be more inclusive than just a business model, bringing business success to everyone. We do not conceive development if it doesn’t consider social and environmental variables. We became a B Corp because an enterprise that generates a solution for a social and/or environmental problem creates value where it is lacking. The bicycle is a metaphor for development. In a bicycle, through coordinated motion, in which every part plays a fundamental role, the moving forward capacity is multiplied without losing touch with the real world and what surrounds us; we are key players of our movement. We want to use the tools we are given from the world to serve its own development. That’s why our projects begin within communities and organizations, helping to develop from within any changes necessary to sustainable development. Offering real value from people and for people. With this scope, we manage and develop different projects in communities, as well as offering consultant services to enterprises or organizations, from whatever industry or economic sector, with a focus on improving internal practices and incorporating sustainable standards in their management and business models, internal valuation practices and improvement programs. We support the adoption of Enterprise Social Responsibility policies and practices, and B Corp certification.The Change We Seek We wish to encourage organizations and communities we are bound to in order to guide them toward a sustainable development in a human scale, placing people at its center. We wish to support a way of doing business that dialogues and listen to people, guarding human needs and future generations.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Abramar is a multi-disciplinary real estate developer, pioneer of Social Urbanism, meeting rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, transparency and financial returns. The profitable, award winning company leads its markets by selling top-quality yet affordable housing to lower-middle income buyers while remaining a steward of the city and the environment. Abramar's projects are audited by Deloitte LLP, have received an A- credit rating from Austin Rating, obtained GERIC from Caixa and has credit lines with most major banks. Abramar is a frequent keynote speaker on such as events like "social entrepreneurship" (at the Beijing Forum), "happiness" (At Columbia University), "real estate development" (At REIW São Paulo) and "online business management" (At Google HQ), and has been featured in publications such as The Economist and Money Today. The team represents 6 nationalities, is 50% bi-lingual, 50% women, 70% practice sports regularly, and thanks to its low turnover tenure length averages 4 years. One fifth of the team is dedicated to intellectual property which allows Abramar to innovate technology and design for scalable positive impact in the neighborhoods it develops. We believe that value is measured not just in financial return but also social and environmental impact, so we wanted to be part of a community of companies that feel the same. The B Corp community is a step in the right direction of changing the conversation world wide on what value really is. We think that as part of the B Corp community we can broaden our reach to evolve the build world. The Change We Seek Over the next 20 years the world will construct enough housing that if we stacked it, it would equate to 5 buildings to the moon! The way we develop these 'moonscrapers' will influence our quality of life, consumption, energy usage, nature and the urban landscape. Through Social Urbanism we've created a method of high environmental and social standards that can improve the quality of life for thousands of families and future generations directly and indirectly not just in Brazil but any country.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Ematris is a consulting company based in Chile dedicated to boosting innovators and social, cultural and business entrepreneurs, through consulting, coaching and fundraising from private and public sources. Each part of the consulting process is designed to create learning experiences that enable entrepreneurs to strengthen their businesses. Ematris also employs young entrepreneurs in part-time jobs, so they can work with other projects, build networks, and create experiences of success in an environment of continuous development that they can apply in their own businesses. In Chile, 53% of microenterprises do not pass their first year of life, and the 0.3% that grow to be large are almost all technology-based. On the other hand, researchers from universities and other centers of excellence don't have the skills or time to transfer their developed technology to the market. Thus, support is necessary to provide tools to entrepreneurs in order for them to achieve success in their projects and to develop and create positive change in society.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: B-Green is an environmental agency based in Argentina with local and global coverage, which works with companies, governments and the community, in the development and implementation of innovative actions that result in environmental and social benefits. We became B Corp because we believe in an economy where equality and inclusion can prevail, and where the ultimate goal is not the benefit of the few at the expense of poverty for many. We found in this system a great environment for companies with community purposes, where they can grow and spread this message to the world by demonstrating that it is possible. The implementation is done across different areas of management involved in the processes: institutional relationships, human resources and marketing; designing together customized solutions tailored to each target. We focus in helping forward-thinking organizations become sustainable leaders of the present, injecting sustainability into the company³s DNA through new implementations focused on people. This can be achieved through different tools, including: environmental best practices programs, workshops and training sessions for executives, public massive campaigns, sustainable BTL communication, design of carbon neutral events, etc. The Change We Seek™ B-Green seeks to increase awareness about the rational use of natural resources and environmental care, to improve people’s quality of life. Through the development of new ideas that solve the needs of companies and governments as well as consumers, B-Green aims to shorten the gap between the private and the community interests. Thus, all the gears of society may work towards personal benefits, while sharing a new goal: To improve quality of life for current and future generations.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Sanosnack was founded by a group of entrepreneurs who, amazed by the overweight and obesity rates in Chile, wondered: What snack will my kids eat at school? What is healthy that I can eat at my workplace? Sanosnack is committed to providing healthy snack to customers as well as educating them on nutrition and healthy eating habits. Sanosnack Vending Machines have the latest technology that provides a high standard shopping experience. The eco-friendly vending machines give customers access to healthy snacks and information in one place. We are a B Corporation because, not only do we want our business to be profitable, but we also believe that all our stakeholders (customers, suppliers, employees and partners) generate positive externalities for themselves and others and therefore, should be highly valued. The Change We Seek The Sanosnack team believes it can change the world through: 1. Providing access to healthy food at reasonable prices in workplaces and schools 2. Innovating in a very competitive, concentrated and low quality service vending industry 3. Focusing its energy on self-care and philanthropy, allowing others to help themselves 4. Supporting healthy brands and emerging local SMEs ​ ​ ​

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: CDI Ventures is a social enterprise created by CDI to use technology to empower low income communities through social businesses. The first social venture initiative is CDI Lan, which affiliates cybercafes to work in partnership as a channel to distribute products and services focused on education and financial inclusion. Nowadays, there are 6,500 of cybercafes members and CDI Lan provides training, income generation and empowerment to these micro and small entrepreneurs through a gamified platform. We became B Corp to join and contribute to a group of organizations committed to create, develop, implement and promote change for a more equal, sustainable and better world.The Change We Seek CDI was created in 1995 with the mission to democratize the access to Information Technology and Communications. After 17 years, 1.5 million people learned IT and citizenship through 717 communities centers in 12 countries. Now, through social businesses, CDI Ventures seek to transform lives by empowering small and micro entrepreneurs in low income communities using technology focusing on education and financial inclusion. People educated, informed, empowered by financial and technological tools are ready to act as changemakers and promote the change in scalable and impactful mode.

Their products are radiated with intention and they are engaged with the self-growth of their team members in order to offer conscious, harmonic and healthy products. Due to its location on a rural environment, Santosh organically grows some of the ingredients used in their products and involves peasant community (specially women) as workers and suppliers. Our company was born from the need to live in a natural environment and to develop a coherent way of life with purpose, we are a B corp because human potential and love for earth passionate us. We are glad to belong to a community that vibrates like us, that inspires us and that permanently motivates us to be better. The Change We Seek Santosh believes that each individual is a motor of change; its constant mission is to grow in conscious and love day by day, radiating its near nuclei and promoting a web of responsible producers, retailers and consumers, with common values that bring harmony to their surrounding environments.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Tools4change delivers consultancy on strategies, tools, and services to the non profit sector to raise money from private sector through fundraising campaigns, cause-related marketing and Corporate Social Responsible initiatives. For Tools4change, what matters is not just how much wealth companies are generating, but how they are doing it and the value they are creating for their environment, employees, and community. Tools4change advises NGOs and foundations on their marketing strategies and fund development, supporting them in the proper implementation and management of their activities. They also work with companies interested in including CRS as part of their corporate vision. Through this dual role, Tools4change wants to serve as a nexus between the private and the so-called "third sector," approaching and complementing both realities and thereby fulfilling their contribution to build a better world. We became a B Corp since we have the same goals, principles and values: we want to make a living by doing something concrete to have a better world. \We are proud to be part of a team of collaborators, clients and suppliers committed with the same goal. The Change We Seek Tools wants to put an end to the idea that individuals and/or companies only help to "give back". They want to break with these existing paradigms, helping people and companies inherently understand and appreciate the benefits they get from helping each other. The non-profit sector urgently needs funds from the private sector to finance their work in order to attend the social needs that the State can not satisfy.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: SSC Wood is a native wood processing mill in southern Chile for dry lumber production. They operate under certification standards for sustainability and Fair Trade. The company markets its products to international markets with dual seal FSC-FLO, making it the only company in the world offering this combination of stamps. The raw material used comes from small farmers of native forests - both local and indigenous communities. Additionally, their producers belong to an association of Fair Trade. The SSC Wood model is based on production with local identity and seeks to create community value. In orderto do so, they have developed partnerships with designers, architects and companies that seek to offer products with environmental and social accountability. SSC Wood also seeks to create value for the management of native forests in order to further their recovery and long-term sustainability. Becoming a B Corp seemed like a natural step in our journey to establish a sustainable business model, with the added benefits of belonging to a community of companies that share our values. Furthermore, this community enabled us grow and expand our borders, as well as improved our position in the markets. Certification gives us credibility and is crucial to our marketing. The Change We Seek SSC Wood wants to show the world that people can have a profitable business without sacrificing the environment and community. Moreover, they aim to show that one can establish a truly inclusive business, where the ocmmunity formed by the employees within the production chain, and their families, directly shape the success of the company. SSC Wood also hopes, through certification, to educate consumers who ultimatley make the decision to buy a product or service.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Karün is a Chilean B corporation that offers sustainable and high-quality eyewear designed to last. Through its Karün Regeneration Model, the brand demonstrates that companies can be a tool for social and environmental well-being. Karün's products are made with recycled and traceable materials, collected in collaboration with local rural communities in Patagonia to restore natural ecosystems and regenerate local economies. In addition to its commitment to sustainability, Karun is a pioneer in transparency by providing information on the carbon emissions of each product and allowing customers to track the production process through its Karun Traceability System, powered by blockchain technology. Today, the brand is present in more than 17 countries worldwide and has been recognized by leading sustainability organizations such as MIDO, National Geographic, and Forbes. Learn more about the brand at karuneyewear.com.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Trum manufactures three products geared towards helping those in wheelchairs enjoy the pleasure of biking. The first product is the 'Handcycle' device that transforms wheelchairs into bicycles. The second major product is the "Tricycle", a bicycle for seniors, allowing them to move in a safer way. Lastly, the "Everywhere" device attaches and enabled the wheelchair to gain mobility in adverse terrain, sand and swamps. We became a B Corp because our core values align with the B Corp community. We are proud to be able to solve the basic need to move around the world. The Change We Seek Trum seeks to grant the possibility of social reintegration for people with some kind of reduction in their mobility and help them improve their health.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Founded by a group of Mexican entrepreneurs headed by Francisco Vizcaya, FINAE is a social impact financial institution specialized in student loans in order to support Mexican students who do not have enough financial resources to pay for their undergraduate tuitions. FINAE provides the students a product that allows them to study in a qualified University at an affordable monthly payment. Once they start working, they are able to payback without having a high impact in their expected income. Founded in October 2006, FINAE grants its first student loans in November 2007. The idea of offering student loans emerged as a solution to the actual situation of public universities: every year, about 350,000 youngsters in age to attend college are not able to do it because public universities are overcrowded and they lack of resources to pay for a private university. There are 10 million students between 19 and 23 years old, of which only 3 million goes to college, that is to say, there are more than 7 million college-age youngsters who do not study, which is equivalent to almost the entire population of Switzerland, or the entire population of Chicago.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: CHAMANA is a Latin American company of high quality herbal infusions, which come in little bags. Their products inspire a balnce of the body, mind and spirit through aromas and flavors that connect with different sensations. Their commitment is based in the creation and commercialization of infusions and products that promote wellness and health. CHAMANA looks to add sustainable economic and social value in the company and community, while honoring and respecting nature. As a result of these initiatives and commitments, Chamana is recognized in the Latin American community as a company identified with people and committed to building a better world. We became a B Corp because we are convinced that the way to reach our mission is through an interdependence with entrepreneurial communities that think, act, and learn with our same values and principles.The Change We Seek CHAMANA has integrated social responsibility practices with their employees, suppliers, and customers to achieve a sustained, long-term commitment. Their business vision includes respect for people and the environment, while maintaining strong ethical values in every action. In their new packaging plant in Del Viso, a number of changes have been made to enhance CHAMANA's eco-efficiency. Among the most notable highlights is the efficiency of the lighting system, which allowed CHAMANA to generate a savings of 43% annually, as well as the solar tank, which cut annual carbon emissions by 0.47 tons.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Enova is a social enterprise that designs, builds and operates 95 centers that offer access to education and technology based on the needs of low-income communities in Mexico. Their mission is to improve people’s academic and vocational skills through technology. Enova’s solution to these challenges is the Red de Innovación y Aprendizaje (RIA), or the Learning and Innovation Network. The network includes a chain of 70 educational centers that provide low-income Mexican communities with quality educational opportunities and access to information technologies. The network is expanding quickly, with 25 Digital Libraries inaugurated in 2013. Every week 3,000 individuals sign up at the RIA centers to become members. Enova's differentiating strategy is that in addition to providing users with access to technology, it develops the tools needed to use it effectively and incorporate the necessary elements for effective learning. The model integrates four main components: 1) access to robust IT infrastructure, 2) selection and development of relevant educational content for all ages, ranging from basic competencies to use of technology and English as a second language 3) a blended e-learning model with skilled facilitators, and 4) analysis of each student’s performance to revise and improve course content. We feel that it is important to be part of a group that shares our vision of having a high social impact while creating value. As we continue to grow, it will be increasingly important that we act transparently and be held accountable. This, in turn, will improve our performance and will help us become a better company as well as deliver more value to our communities and stakeholders. The Change We Seek Enova's vision is to improve the academic and vocational skills of low-income Mexicans through technology. Envoa’s aim is threefold: 1) create digital citizens, 2) produce educational impact, and 3) generate opportunities for Mexicans. Enova's centers promote the development of more well-educated, connected, global and confident individuals. The courses offered not only attend to academic and technology training, but also on personal and professional developments. Enova believes that skills building is a lifelong activity and thus offers training for every age and education level. The company understands that each person is different and learns differently. The academic programs are taught through the use of technology and facilitators to assure that every student succeeds. All centers are equipped with a learning platform that allows student performance to be measured and by consequence, improved. Enova ultimately seeks to change the lives of low-income Mexicans by offering unique learning experiences, access to technologies at accessible costs and delivering high quality educational results.

Each of our pieces tells a story to inspire you as a citizen of the world. At Wakami, we believe in creating products and experiences with love for the earth and its people. By consciously crafting each of our products, we inspire our artisans to make their dreams a reality and our customers to love a life of purpose.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: ByoEarth promotes vermicomposting and its organic fertilizer in rural and urban communities in order to improve the living conditions of vulnerable populations. Forty percent of the world’s soil is heavily degraded, compromising the ability to grow food and nurture families. The solution combines vermicomposting with poverty eradication in vulnerable rural and urban areas, helps the populations to address imperative issues such as food security and environmental pollution and, educates farmers on how to avoid the dependency of chemical fertilizer. Red worms (Eisenia Fetida) are the agents of change because it is through their digestion process, that biodegradable waste is transformed into 100% organic fertilizer. This technique is well known and holds the capacity for more environmentally friendly waste management while at the same time empowers women and disadvantaged communities to make sustainable livelihood out of waste. Byoearth’s mission is to enable users to generate valuable products out of waste: solid organic fertilizer, worm tea fertilizer and worms themselves because economic, social and environmental impact can come directly from this and the solution is replicable worldwide! The Change We Seek ByoEarth educates local communities on the importance of biodegradable waste management and provides technical training in adopting vermicomposting. ”I want people in Guatemala to know that waste is really wealth,” Maria states. There is a way for them to generate an income and be environmentally sustainable by selling and using vermicompost. Byoearth wants groups and individuals throughout Guatemala to adopt this process because it “returns organic fertilizers to the earth.” Three different communities near Guatemala City have banded together to tackle their mounting waste problem. They invested in the vermicomposting process and began converting their organic waste into fertilizer, while also generating a key source of income. The main objectives of ByoEarth include:Enhanced, sustainable agricultural productivityGreater food security for the local communityLand use sustainability ByoEarth’s 5-year vision is to enable more than 10,000 Guatemalan farmers to reduce their dependence on and usage of chemical fertilizers. “I want to take nature’s processes and maximize them,” Maria concludes. The task is to continue to explore ways in which communities can use nature’s processes in sustainable and even profitable ways.” Why We Became a B Corp We became a B Corp because we want to make a real change in Guatemala, and we think that becoming part of this community of social entrepreneurs will serve as a learning platform to engage with new partners, improve our performance and enhance our impact.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Echale a Tu Casa is a social housing production company that delivers affordable homes to communities through the implementation of innovations in construction, technology and finance. Echale a Tu Casa’s model aims to restructure community social networking and cure the flaws inherent in the self-building process through four pillars: Organization and Social Inclusion,Financial Education and access to Social Finance Trust,Training and Technology Appropriation,Program replication through Social Impact Franchise. Echale’s sustainable housing model brings a systemic solution for the selfbuilder families. Becoming a B Corp certifies that that both the economic and social values of our model are part of our mission and rates our effectiveness in accomplishing them. The Change We Seek In spite of unprecedented economic and demographic growth over the past several years, many developing nations are confronted with the perpetual problem of housing. Today there is a total housing deficit of over 400 million around the world. In order to cope with a flawed housing delivery system, most families construct their own homes magnifying the problem since materials are inherently expensive and financing for this segment of the market is limited. Thus, housing fails to fulfill its basic economic function of building household wealth and falls short in its social function. Echale Tu Casa seeks to revert this vicious cycle by correcting the flaws inherent to the self-build process, thus allowing it to deliver returns on economic, social, and environmental levels. Through Echale’s innovative model, families can build their own home becoming proprietors of a patrimony that they can count on and inherit to the next generation. Securing a house provides families, and entire communities, the opportunity to focus on their development and househols wealth

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Echale a Tu Casa is a social housing production company that delivers affordable homes to communities through the implementation of innovations in construction, technology and finance. Echale a Tu Casa’s model aims to restructure community social networking and cure the flaws inherent in the self-building process through four pillars: Organization and Social Inclusion,Financial Education and access to Social Finance Trust,Training and Technology Appropriation,Program replication through Social Impact Franchise. Echale’s sustainable housing model brings a systemic solution for the selfbuilder families. Becoming a B Corp certifies that that both the economic and social values of our model are part of our mission and rates our effectiveness in accomplishing them. The Change We Seek In spite of unprecedented economic and demographic growth over the past several years, many developing nations are confronted with the perpetual problem of housing. Today there is a total housing deficit of over 400 million around the world. In order to cope with a flawed housing delivery system, most families construct their own homes magnifying the problem since materials are inherently expensive and financing for this segment of the market is limited. Thus, housing fails to fulfill its basic economic function of building household wealth and falls short in its social function. Echale Tu Casa seeks to revert this vicious cycle by correcting the flaws inherent to the self-build process, thus allowing it to deliver returns on economic, social, and environmental levels. Through Echale’s innovative model, families can build their own home becoming proprietors of a patrimony that they can count on and inherit to the next generation. Securing a house provides families, and entire communities, the opportunity to focus on their development and househols wealth

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: FRUANDES’ unique flavors are the result of an equally unique journey that starts in rural Colombia, where FRUANDES’ farmers live, harvest and select the best produce that gets delivered to FRUANDES’ distribution centers. All produce is transported and received in FRUANDES’ production plant in Bogota following strict quality standards. Once the fresh fruit reaches their facilities, they carefully analyze and select each piece according to its ripeness. After this, each fruit undergoes a washing and disinfection phase, which is followed by the fruit-specific peeling, cutting, dehydration and final quality control & packaging process. Organic Dried Mango, Organic Dried Physalis, Dried Pineapple, Dried Dragon Fruit, Organic Dried Baby Banana - and our specials Organic Whole Sugar Cane and Organic Cocoa Nibs - are therefore, the result of a delicate manual processing, which magically translates into an unforgettable flavor that resembles the Colombian Andes and the caring work performed by every individual involved in the process.

text_snippet: Founded by a group of Mexican entrepreneurs headed by Francisco Vizcaya, FINAE is a social impact financial institution specialized in student loans in order to support Mexican students who do not have enough financial resources to pay for their undergraduate tuitions. FINAE provides the students a product that allows them to study in a qualified University at an affordable monthly payment. Once they start working, they are able to payback without having a high impact in their expected income. Founded in October 2006, FINAE grants its first student loans in November 2007. The idea of offering student loans emerged as a solution to the actual situation of public universities: every year, about 350,000 youngsters in age to attend college are not able to do it because public universities are overcrowded and they lack of resources to pay for a private university. There are 10 million students between 19 and 23 years old, of which only 3 million goes to college, that is to say, there are more than 7 million college-age youngsters who do not study, which is equivalent to almost the entire population of Switzerland, or the entire population of Chicago.

The film was made available online and reached over one million viewers, besides being utilized to coach Brazilian health and educational professionals. Maria Farinha Filmes also has other projects that involve research in children play, Brazilian culture, and activism that are being produced for TV, cinema and the Internet. Audiovisual content has shown itself to be a tool of extreme efficiency that possesses great potential power for transformation. Unfortunately, themes necessary to improve humanity are generally treated with less care than commercially driven ones. Maria Farinha explores those themes while always searching for quality and excellence. Also, in the making of Maria Farinha's films, sets are always functioning with social and environmental concerns in mind.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Onda Orgánica offers clothes made with organic cotton and fair work conditions in the Cordoba province of Argentina. Through their garments, the brand seeks to create awareness about the environmental and social situation in Argentina and to offer an ethical consumerism option. The use of organic cotton in garments avoids not only environmental contamination, but also water pollution. Onda Orgánica also cares about the health of workers and families that live near the crops. By producing their clothes in in responsible workshops, Onda Orgánica contributes to social justice by avoiding child labor, slave labor, and human trafficking. By becoming a B Corp, we hope to connect with other people sharing our same ideology, to share experiences and challenges that exist in the market, and to build future alliances. We are ready to be a real B Corp ambassador through future presentations and events. It will be a pleasure to share knowledge and help to boost action with other B Corps and build a sustainable synergy.The Change We Seek Onda Orgánica tries to help solve two main issues: 1. Environmental issues: In the Cordoba Province alone, 50 million liters of glyphosate are used annually. This toxic weedkiller not only pollutes the environment, but also causes diseases like cancer in workers and their families. 2. Social issues: Almost 80% of the textile industry uses clandestine workshops for their production. Also, in 2013 unemployment reached 7.2%, which means there are almost 3 million unemployed people in Argentina. Onda Orgánica feels very proud of:Offering garments with ecological and social values.Being an activist company in society and trying to plant the sustainability seed in other people’s minds. ​

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Cubiertosdemadera.com is a a Certified B Corporation and a producer of disposable wooden cutlery. They are located in Santiago, Chile. They focus on making planet and people-friendly products using wood. Wood, as we all know is a renewable resource. Aspenware manufactures fully compostable, disposable wooden cutlery. Their product line includes a fork, a knife, and a spoon. Comparable in size to conventional cutlery, the utensils are lightweight and strong, as well as ergonomically designed and aesthetically pleasing. The pieces are designed for strength, with forks able to pierce a raw carrot, spoons able to eat hard ice cream and knives able to slice easily through steak. Their cutlery is all natural, comprised of two layers of aspen/poplar and pine veneers both planted and farmed in Chile. The cutlery is coated with a Carnauba wax that eliminates any wooden taste and feel. We became a B Corp because we believe that we can have a sustainable world.The Change We Seek Cubiertosdemadera.com wants all people in the world stop using plastic cutlery.

text_snippet: Ecoservice operates in construction. Their goal is to be a benchmark in sustainable products, systems and services for the building industry. Their mission is to improve people's quality of life and interaction with the environment through the reduction of waste, the rational use of natural resources and the increased disposable income gained by reducing energy and water consumption. To reduce the environmental impact and carbon emissions involved in all stages of construction, including the stage of use, Ecoservice commercializes: Solar heating systems; Rain water harvesting systems; Photovoltaic Solar power generation systems; Green roof systems, Green Walls and Permeable Pavements; Plastic Lumber; Central Vacuums; and Reflective Solar lighting. They also offer services like: Dimensioning of systems; Projects; Technical Guidance; Appropriateness of projects; and Installation of all products offered and maintenance.The Change We Seek The construction industry is singled out as the human activity that most consumes natural resources and uses energy intensively, generating considerable environmental impacts. In addition to the impacts related to the consumption of matter and energy, there are those associated with the generation of solid wastes, liquids and gases. It is estimated that over 50% of solid waste generated by all the human activities comes from building. Ecoservice seeks to change this scenario.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: B-Green is an environmental agency based in Argentina with local and global coverage, which works with companies, governments and the community, in the development and implementation of innovative actions that result in environmental and social benefits. We became B Corp because we believe in an economy where equality and inclusion can prevail, and where the ultimate goal is not the benefit of the few at the expense of poverty for many. We found in this system a great environment for companies with community purposes, where they can grow and spread this message to the world by demonstrating that it is possible. The implementation is done across different areas of management involved in the processes: institutional relationships, human resources and marketing; designing together customized solutions tailored to each target. We focus in helping forward-thinking organizations become sustainable leaders of the present, injecting sustainability into the company³s DNA through new implementations focused on people. This can be achieved through different tools, including: environmental best practices programs, workshops and training sessions for executives, public massive campaigns, sustainable BTL communication, design of carbon neutral events, etc. The Change We Seek™ B-Green seeks to increase awareness about the rational use of natural resources and environmental care, to improve people’s quality of life. Through the development of new ideas that solve the needs of companies and governments as well as consumers, B-Green aims to shorten the gap between the private and the community interests. Thus, all the gears of society may work towards personal benefits, while sharing a new goal: To improve quality of life for current and future generations.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Lumni is a new kind of financial services company dedicated to ensuring that students everywhere can leverage their most valuable asset - their own future potential - to access financing for college. Unlike traditional student lenders, they fundamentally align the interest of their investors and students in a win-win relationship that benefits everyone. Lumni's investment funds don't make loans. Instead, students commit a fixed percentage of income for the 10 years after they graduate. This dramatically reduces the risk of unmanageable payments after graduation in the case of unemployment or underemployment, giving debt-averse, underserved college students the comfort to take a leap. Lumni also employs an innovative underwriting process, determining creditworthiness not on access to co-signer like traditional lenders, but instead on a student's personal drive and potential. This allows Lumni to identify qualified clients from with the country's most underserved populations, students who would be deemed too risky by private lenders. Finally, Lumni distinguishes itself by building a relationship with its students and supporting them with career coaching and development services.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Flowing asks questions, looks for answers and gives solutions to what they live day by day in their homes, schools, nature and society. Some of these questions are:Why have children lost the shine in their eyes?Why is there so much frustration?Why are illness, violence and destruction normal?Why are we destroying nature?Why have we lost our essence… our principles, in other words, our values and habits? Flowing has found some answers to these questions… something happened, they suddenly changed their beliefs thinking that love is overprotection, life should be easy, fast and effortless, success is having a lot of money and so on… these beliefs have generated negative consequences in children, youth, adults, nature and society… people have lost their harmony. The principal tool used in Flowing to give solutions to these questions has been the Langford Method created by Sylvia Langford during 30 years of observation and work. She states that an entrepreneur is a person that is happy, because he/she has a dream and works everyday to make it come true. An entrepreneur is a leader of his/her life, values teamwork, respects nature, has habits and principles, develops skills and lives in harmony. The Langford Method is an innovative concrete proposal that has three focuses:Understand the importance of being an authority or leader.Give a concrete and practical proposal to work with children and youth: human development and the essence of being an entrepreneur.Understand the importance of leadership and teamwork. Since 2009 the Langford Method has been officially applied in 180 schools, kindergartens, universities and children homes throughout Chile from La Serena down to Punta Arenas. Since 2013, Flowing has begun working with enterprises. This year all of their books and materials are being translated into English to face demands in English speaking countries during 2016. Over 12,000 children, youth, their parents and teachers have worked with the method. Around 30,000 people have attended talks. There has been great interest to know more about Flowing's proposal in books they have published, articles and interviews in magazines, press, radio and TV.The Change We Seek Flowing is working hard on changing beliefs. They believe that:A leader must be calm, patient, precise in his instructions, close, systematic and coherent in order to be capable of solving conflicts through dialogue and understanding.Happiness is a choice; it is a way of living.Dreams come true with systematic work, effort and discipline.Sustainability will allow them to take care of the planet.An entrepreneur is a person that builds is life day-by-day.Teamwork is collaborative work.Love is: trust, listening, respect, empathy and developing autonomy.

VISION: Full Runners is convinced of the benefits of sport at all levels. They hope to encourage all Chileans to engage in physical activity and sport in a continuous and lifelong manner. MISSION: To offer a personalized service with the highest standards to its members so that even as amateurs they can train, be entertained, and live the best way possible. Full Runners motivates all people to play sports on an ongoing and lifelong basis, offers quality service and nationwide coverage, contributes to structural change in Chile's PRO SPORTS laws, brings sports to underserved populations, and delivers the best possible life experience to people regardless of age, physical condition, or economic status. The Change We Seek Full Runners hopes to integrate the values of sports and to improve the quality of life for all.

Its combination of Credit, Insurance and Payments, offer a ground-breaking approach to class E/D businesses, certifying the company as a B Corporation and 2018 B Corp Best for the World honoree. title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: The Products is a social enterprise that is a response to the lack of innovative, effective and accessible furniture to children and young people with physical disabilities, contemplating on the same product function, performance, beauty, autonomy and security. The Products' main solutions are Ciranda, a chair that allows all physical disabled children 1-6 years old to sit on the floor and play with others as an equal, and the first Inclusive School Desk based on the principles of universal design. Innovative, both products enable people with disabilities to fully exercise their citizenship - in all, this audience consists of 3 million children and young people in Brazil (IBGE, 2010). The scarce equipment available in the market so far are heavily associated with the idea of "sickness", they are also costly and not very efficient. Ineffective products, such as these, end up causing a social handicap, mainly in the first years of childhood for handiCapable children, when inclusion is most importance in their formation as a citizen. One of the main challenges of the 21st century is to create new ways of undertaking, which means changing old habits to embrace the new, the daring, the innovative, and the committed to the action. Means do not aim to profit at the expense of issues related to the social, environmental and economic ills that plague the society from the very beginning we try to be present by those who somehow believe in this form of activity. Becoming a Certificated B Corp proves our commitments, it was recognized worldwide and finally uses parameters and metrics that we believe are fundamental for our type of business. Working in the certification process itself is an opportunity to enhance our operating model showing points that we need to grow, rethink and give us the opportunity to enhance a better governance process. The Change We Seek The Products seeks to improve society through an innovative and profitable business model aimed at greater equality of opportunities. They are providing products for the inclusion of physically disabled children, so that in the future they may be inserted productively in the community with all their rights and obligations. Creating innovative technologies and generating a stream of innovations that aim to reduce social inequality for a part of the population that until recently depended solely on society is the purpose of their business.

text_snippet: Incluyeme.com is the first job portal in Latin America aimed to help people with disabilities to find a job. Incluyeme.com focuses on generating and disseminating employment opportunities to vulnerable groups such as disabled people, men and women over 45 years old and young people at social risk. We strongly believe in the B Corp Declaration. We want to share our experiences and learn from other companies that have the same purpose, and want to make a difference in the world. We are sure that with commitment, hard work, and good intentions all the B Corps can make a big difference. The Change We Seek The unemployment rate for people with disabilities in Latin America reaches about 70% and is affecting more than 30 million people. Meanwhile, there are several companies with inclusion and diversity programs that find it difficult to hire the right people. A place where companies and people with disabilities can meet each other is needed, and Incluyeme.com is the solution. Currently, Incluyeme.com is working with several big companies, which share more than a 1,000 job opportunities for people with disabilities on their website, helping them to show their inclusion programs and get the best talent from people with disabilities.

text_snippet: Tonka SA is a family owned company with 80 employees. They are an Argentine metallurgical company that develops and fabricates gas controls for household gas appliances. Innovation is a way of living for them. The company started 46 years ago with an innovation and Tonka SA has been doing so for all these years. They design and create security and control devices for instant water heaters, stoves, heaters and many other appliances. Due to existing public policies, fossil energies have been very cheap for the last decades. For this reason there is no culture for the rational use of these natural resources. In the last year, conditions changed and natural gas became very expensive due to importations at international prices. With Tonka SAÕs innovation policies and strong research and development position, their company supplies the local industry with the necessary products needed to save gas and promote the essential use of it. Tonka SA deals with energy. They hope to help society use it well in order to save natural resources. Environment and society needs to be taken into consideration when providing the industry that creates gas appliances. Tonka SAÕs mission as a company is not only oriented around saving energy, but also seeking to promote the common good within society.

The second course is through developing GeCo projects and partnership initiatives that add value for all the involved parts by incorporating the base of the pyramid to the business value chain. One example of this is the case of the development of a maqui nectar "Newen Maqui " that was implemented with local harvesting communities, private companies, and the public sector. Today this is a product that, in addition to be beneficial to the environment and consumers, returns part of the profitability to communities. For more information, visit www.newenmaqui.cl.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Ouro Verde Amazonia Ouro Verde Amazonia is a company created in 2002 by young entrepreneurs in the heart of the Amazon region. Originally built over two strong pillars (a new model of fair relationship with its suppliers – native Amazon communities – and strong investment in R&D to create added value and high nutritional value products made with native Amazon Fruits - mainly Brazil Nut and Açai Berry), The company, now is part of Grupo Orsa, promotes regional development through the sustainable use of natural resources. Based on fair commerce practices and training programs for gathering, storage and sale of raw Amazonian Fruits, our company was an innovator in developing an equitable and harmonious relationship with the indigenous communities, family farmers and rubber collectors. Thanks to its practices, Ouro Verde Amazonia earned organic certification for the entire product line from Ecocert Brasil. Over its nine years of existence, the company has consolidated a business model that stood out for its distinctive relationship with the traditional communities of the Amazon, including several indigenous ethnic groups, residents of several Resex (Federal Extractive Reserves) and smallholder farmers. This unique model was guided by the fair-trade and above-average prices paid to suppliers. In Brazil, the extraction of Brazil Nut is characterized by high concentration of production in a few states; the Acre, Amazonas and Pará hold 80.7% of production. Other states (Rondonia, Mato Grosso, Amapa and Roraima) must share the remaining 19.3%. The Northern Region is responsible for 98.72% of national production of Brazil nut, with direct impacts on the lives of extractive communities, small farmers and indigenous people. Through fair trade and ethical practices, Ouro Verde seeks to create more positive impacts in these communities, as well as for consumers. We believe in a new business model in which sharing benefits, ethical approach and solidarity are the strong bases that should support these “new generation companies.” The ending and fair financial result, which is essential for the longevity of the companies, should be an obvious and necessary result of this equation. By becoming a B Corp, we would like to share these principles with other “sister companies” around the world, learn alternative ways to reinforce these kind of principles, and add an additional water drop to the B Corporations Initiatives by sharing our history .The Change We Seek Ouro Verde Amazonia believes that one of the biggest challenges for the future of the Amazon region is to reorder old regional supply chains of its native products, like Açai Berry and Brazil Nut. These supply chains are historically characterized as unbalanced and unfair; by consolidating them in a new business model, they can be made more sustainable and harmonious by sharing the benefits of producing some of the healthiest nature foods with the native Amazonian communities. Implementation of this sustainable business model would generate at least three clear benefits: better life for local Amazon communities, maintenance of the majestic Amazon Forest (no deforestation) and widespread supply of highly healthy food (Açai and Brazil Nut) for consumers around the world. For Ouro Verde, and for all those interested in preserving the world’s largest tropical forest, production of goods made from the Brazil nut is a question of believing in a better future. The mission is to combine economic satisfaction with environmental protection, emphasizing a profound respect for nature and generating opportunities for all suppliers, employees and consumers through the practice of fair trade, ethical values and high quality services.

text_snippet: Xinca generates work for people who are in a state of social vulnerability through shoemaking, while respecting their commitment to sustainability and the environment. In the productive process, Xinca offers job opportunities to people who, for different reasons, cannot have a formal job. Xinca provides these workers with the input materials so that they can bring them home, glue the pieces together and cut them out so that Xinca can finish the product in the factory. We became a B Corp because we believe in impact. We pursue social and environmental changes using the same methods and techniques of a conventional company. The Change We Seek Xinca wants to be more than just shoes. They do business in a different manner, with social and environmental commitment. Without betraying their values and enjoy while they do what they like. Xinca dreams of a better world and will do their part.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: IGNIA is a venture capital investment firm that supports the founding and expansion of high growth social enterprises that serve the base of the socio-economic pyramid (BoP) in Latin America. IGNIA's social investment focus is to fight poverty by developing profitable, highly scalable businesses that serve the needs of the Base of the Pyramid population in areas of exceptional need including health, housing, and education. These businesses provide services and products that ultimately improve the quality of life of the BoP and enable them to generate wealth for themselves. The B Corp certification provides a standard, credible means for investors and partners to recognize IGNIA's commitment not only to deliver substantial social change in our core business of investing in the BoP, but also in how we treat our employees, environment, and stakeholders.The Change We Seek™ By providing effective responses to the enormously underserved needs of low income populations, both as consumers as well as active participants in productive value chains, IGNIA empowers entrepreneurship and generates social impact while creating attractive financial returns for its investors. The largest market in Latin America is comprised of people who earn less than US$3,000 per year. These 360 million people represent the BoP market, which, in aggregate, is estimated at US$510 Billion. By providing capital to businesses in this marketplace, we enrich the community to higher standards of living while at the same time using this goal to attract investors and create a profitable return. IGNIA believes that the only way to address the poverty disparity in the BoP and tap into the aggregate market presence is through business. This is not achieved through one firm, but through the creation of an industry, which is the natural outgrowth of an economic activity which generates levels of profitability equal or higher than those with the same risk profile. IGNIA is jump-starting this industry and opening the door for other sources of capital to support impoverished regions of Mexico.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Parque del Recuerdo is the first cemetery in Chile that utilizes a novel concept of landscaping in their services. Over the past 40 years, Parque del Recuerdo has helped families cope with the loss of a loved one. They are committed to provide professional support to those who need it. In the past five years, they have carried out the only existing study about Chilean culture and death. The results have been shared in the community, and they have addressed their strategies based on the needs of individuals, diversifying, for example rites and memorial services. Since its creation, Parque del Recuerdo has become a popular green space in Santiago- which is one of the world's top ten polluted cities. The gardens are one of the many attractions to the cemetery where you can find every kind of flora and fauna. Parque del Recuerdo spans over 452.2 acres, and it is one of the few resting places for migratory birds.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: TQV is one of the first sustainable hair salons in Chile. They offer their clients a safer salon service using products that have no parabens or harmful chemicals like amonia and phormol. They also make sure that their product's formulas have more natural and organic ingredients and that none of them are tested on animals or come from them (only bee wax, eggs and milk). They also try to create a more sustainable service saving water and energy using special showers and solar energy. In this way, they have created a better environment for their costumers and also for the people that work in the salon. TQV would like to change the way things are done in the beauty salon industry in Chile. With their example they want to prove that, with a little effort, things can be better: you can support your workers, you can use better products and you can have a better environment inside your salon with less toxic chemicals and with better team relationships.

text_snippet: HoraSalud is committed to create services that improve people’s life as well as improving the efficiency of health centers. HoraSalud’s platform allows people to book and/or cancel their appointments via three different communication channels; an mobile app, a web portal and/or a call center, available 24/7 for people to use them, this way they don’t need to wake up early in the morning, travel to their health centers and wait in line for hours only to book an appointment when they are already feeling ill. Users as well receive notifications on the mobile app or receive calls from the call center to remind them of their appointment. HoraSalud is simple and user friendly. It is a powerful tool to support health centers because it helps them to reduce the number of missed appoitments because of people’s absence, HoraSalud is making possible to cancel the appointment before hand, this way the now available appointment will be offered to someone else that may need it. This system integrates Artificial Intelligence to administrate the appointments in order to offer them to the people who need it the most instead of the first person who calls. We are committed to our purpose and we wish to maintain it in time, for it is necessary to make a formal commitment and ensure that future part
