title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Maggacup Argentina is the first company dedicated to the production and sale of the menstrual cup, an innovative and sustainable product Women period. The menstrual cup is a healthy friendly option for their reusable quality, environmental and cost savings. It is produced with hypoallergenic medical grade silicone, brought from Germany. With its use, deforestation and waste generation caused by other options, such as tampons and towels, they are fully avoid. Our goal is to empower women through sound management period. Positive environmental impact: The use of the menstrual cup would save 132,000 tons of non-recyclable waste. From 2013 to 2015, 12,000 cups Maggacup leads sold and avoided 85 million pathological waste menstrual hygiene. In March 2014, Maggacup signed an agreement with the NGO Forest Bank, with the commitment that each mug sold Ong donate to an amount equivalent to 1m2 of the missionary forest. In addition, use of the menstrual cup reduces carbon footprint is also reduced in buying imported menstrual cups. Positive impact social / community: There are women who do not have access to the financial means to stock up on cosmetics. They also lack access to toilets where they can be changed in suitably hygienic conditions and privacy. They are women who use what they have on hand, tea, cotton or mud. About 60% of these women believed that menstrual blood is harmful substances and that his greatest fear is smeared during menstruation, we can infer that the lack of information and embarrassment about menstruation go hand in hand. Positive impact on people: Maggacup already has more than 12 thousand users of menstrual cup. Its use provides several benefits:Care about women (The conventional feminine hygiene products have chemicals that are used for perfuming them, preserve them and blanch).Helps your personal economy (Investment spending on the purchase of the product pays for itself in about 10 months implying a saving of 400% over the annual budget of menstrual pads and tampons.Practicality and comfort.Promotes and requires the entry of the vagina in the body schema and manipulation of menstruation. At the organizational level, the social marketing company Maggacup began betting on relationships and empowerment, so has focused on the development of the initiators of channel and 150 women are more than willing to spread their experience, convey the value and sell the drink in their own community. Maggacup is important to strengthen membership in the community, also improving their personal and family finances ally. We believe that the initiators also as agents of change in their community where they generate a positive transformation. Under the World Day of menstrual hygiene initiative of German NGOs United Wash, with the aim of publicizing the fundamentals of menstrual hygiene in the economy, health, education, environment and human rights; Maggacup from an activity performed in public roads, in the interest of advancing the cause At first launch of the business, we have taken significant discounts, which then planned climb. In turn, from the marketing approach, we have all possible marketing channels. Maggacup has four business lines:The network of resellers: We are committed to the relationship and the empowerment of women so we work with a network of retail selling.Local network / Business: Marketed health products, organic, environmental, etc.Health Network: Maggacup seeks to develop a chain of health professionals to recommend the use of menstrual cup to their patients.E- Commerce: offer to buy the menstrual cup through digital media, as a way of bringing options in marketing the product. Our dissemination strategy and advertising is based on advertising to focus on BTL (bellow the line), media and digital networks that are supported by lower costs. In addition, to establish from the institutional area networks strategic partners with nonprofit organizations, private companies and civil society concerning. Convinced that our nature and essence perfectly match with the B Corporation, we worked for 6 months and got 108 points of 200 in the application process. We are part of the B Corporation Net, since November 2014. The Change We Seek We consider Maggacup as the arrowhead of women and humanity empowerment, through the healthy manage and interaction with our own body. It has impact in three levels: individual, community and humanity. Individually speaking, it impacts positivily in the self-esteem, in the sexual and reproductive health, resulting in the woman²s empowerment. At the comunity level, the effect of individual empowerment, is families and insititutions empowerment; and active citizen participation bio-social-educational. And because of the preservation and restitution of the environment, we get the humanity empowerment (ex: Girl Effect, www.girleffect.org). Magga means "way in the middle" and it is our mantra. We are a social and economic company and both aspects have the same value for us and are permanently interacting and balancing. While the menstrual cup is starting to have the largest circulation in Argentina, most women are using pads and tampons. Argentina In a year generates 3.38 billion units in wipes and tampons. They are products with very short shelf life and are pathogenic wastes that are not treatable or recyclable by waste collection systems. They are hazardous materials because they can be infected with infectious diseases. Furthermore, the raw material for the production of wipes and pads is Kraft pulp or fluff pulp involving 60% of the weight of these methods. Produced from the monoculture of exotic trees. Which it is associated with harmful effects on soil, waterways, vegetation and native fauna. In conclusion, consumption of wipes and tampons mean consumption of the planet's resources and degradation.The INTI (National Institute of Industrial Technology) tested for health fitness of the raw material used to manufacture according to the criteria and standards of the European Pharmacopoeia.The Faculty of Pharmacy and Biochemistry of the UBA (University of Buenos Aires) conducted testings of skin irritation.The industrial design of Maggacup is patented and registered with the INPI (National Institute of Industrial Property).Maggacup is registered in the National Administration of Drugs, Food and Medical Technology (ANMAT).

Nos apasiona trabajar con personas que sueñan en grande y defienden sus ideas. En Simplicity, nos hacemos cargo.

text_snippet: El Viaje de Odiseo is a multidisciplinary team that investigates the potential of social networking related to communication, knowledge management and collaborative work. Since 2005, Odiseo has been creating collaborative platforms for companies and institutions to enable actors to engage and interact together in the design of solutions for a sustainable future. Its mission is to build and manage intelligent networks, which, empowered with internet tools and technology, allow stakeholders to develop new models of socialization, productivity and business organization in order to effectively address our current planetary challenges. Odiseo believes that the adoption of new collaborative networks and its impact in organizations implies new structures of collaboration and governance. This is why the company has developed a methodology for implementing and managing collaborative networks, which also involves guiding organizations during the adoption process. Odiseo is confident that the changes that are generated by networking are directly linked to improving the quality of human relationships and caring for the planet.

text_snippet: Araruna Filmes is a production network that creates audio-visual content for projects related to education, sustainability, human development and culture. They strive to increase the impact of businesses and ideas that make the world a better place through this audio visual content. Araruna Filmes work off horizontal relationships with our stakeholders. At Araruna, they are all PROJECT PARTNERS, which means that their ‘clients’ are now their ‘partners’ and they encourage active involvement in the production process which brings experience, knowledge and talent to their projects. They also seek to attract young professionals to their production process through what they call NETWORK FILMING which is intended to introduce new talent to the industry which is traditionally very hard to penetrate without experience. Their creative process stems from genuine, transparent and collaborative communication. Ultimately Araruna Filmes wants to be a ‘magnifying glass’ for things being done in the world that generate positive effects on the planet!

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Latitud 90 is a tour operator with the mission to generate positive experiences with people. The aim is to give each client the opportunity of learning and entertainment through traveling and participating in educational outdoor programs. With more than 13 years of experience, Latitud 90 specializes in educational outdoor programs, study tours, incentives, consulting, inbound tourism and the administration of camping sites. We became a B Corp because we are a company that has always been concerned with enchanting clients with the natural medium of our programs. We encourage our clients to take care of the environment and use their fascination with nature and outdoor activities to motivate them. In our social programs we support children with few resources and try to give them unique outdoor experiences. We believe that our outdoor activities teach values that our society needs, such as: trust, respect, solidarity, happiness, motivation, empathy. Our healthy working environment and our motivated and committed team makes up the key to our success. Latitud 90 believes that travel is a learning experience which transforms people. This is why each of their programs has been developed with the aim of revealing places, people and history in the most profound and comfortable way, always focusing on preserving the environment and creating a rewarding social setting. They are always looking for new tools to offer sustainable tourism and show the diversity and uniqueness of Chile, its contrasts, its fascinating and remote landscapes. At the same time Latitud 90 fulfills the most demanding wishes of travelers to use educational experiences so they can explore with all their senses. The Change We Seek® The activities that Latitud 90 offers promote values that society seeks. With healthy entertainment, love for nature, and fascination with outdoor activities, they encourage our clients to take care of the environment and to enjoy the richness of nature without leaving a trace.

text_snippet: Mayra Abbondanza is a food engineer and cook, as well as a mother of four children: Pedro, Julia, Francisco and Felipe. Mayra is the author of the book What can I do to make my child eat well and took part in the reality show “My child won’t eat” from the programme Bem Estar, on TV Globo. Mayra was one of the founders of Dedo de Moça and worked for 5 years attending families that wish to eat well at home, inside their houses, having now attended more than 500 families. After this, Mayra founded Dedinho de Moça, which subsequently became known as Mayra Abucham – Feeding Children. Today, she applies her multi-disciplinary experience as a consultant in Conscious Children’s Diets for a healthier generation, as much for brands linked to the culinary world, as well as for families.

text_snippet: Accion Verde is a Colombian for profit enterprise that obtains revenues by producing positive social and environmental impacts, by planting trees in strategic places of Colombia, calling on third party Social Responsibility resources. Accion Verde's founder has been involved in sustainable development, associating my two careers, Economics and Anthropology since the beginning of his professional career. Accion Verde believes that the basis for a more just society, with people and the Planet, must include generating employment, entrepreneurship, with economic benefits for owners as well as collaborators. This social/environmental thrust for sustainable and just development, motivated their team to become a B Corporation. Accion Verde strives to generate ecological restoration in strategic places of Colombia, prevent natural disasters while mitigating climate change. They hope to create a new society, more inclusive and in tune with the protection of the environment, that will help improve the basis for Colombian and Planetary sustainable development. Each person, each enterprise must and should, do a green action (Acción Verde), and Accion Verde offers them that possibility with protective reforestation.

text_snippet: SER develops solutions and business with positive social and environmental impact aligned with the principles of sustainability, collaboration and co-creation. Their daily management model is organic and participatory, where all their partners are co-responsible for the actions taken. From their practices, they seek to inspire and multiply experiences, technologies and learning with positive social and environmental impact. They developed their own methodology that allows them to customize solutions, transforming dreams into reality. Like any systemic organization, SER is constantly evolving in realigning according to their experiences. That is their challenge: to undertake an organization that transforms the environment and itself, so that life can be every day more just, sustainable and happy. The management of an organization that is organic and collaborative is a daily exercise for us. We are all partners and co-responsible for the actions taken. This is a tremendous challenge and be part of an ecosystem in which organizations that also seek this is extremely rewarding. Besides, we desire to join a group that thinks and puts into practice the new definition of success for business. The Change We Seek SER seeks to catalyze the development of social-evironmental solutions that have positive impact in society and therefore enhance alternative socio-economic relations.

text_snippet: Beyond English is a social enterprise based in Santiago, Chile that uses English as a tool to empower global citizens while providing equal access to educational opportunities. They do this through the Beyond English Model that deliberately works towards solving three important problems: the lack of English proficiency among Chilean professionals and executives, educational exclusion in Chile, and the lack of meaningful international opportunities that offer a balance of intrinsic and extrinsic motivators. At Beyond English, they solve these problems by integrating them into one holistic approach. Beyond English's team of passionate globally minded Teaching Fellows go beyond just a normal English class by using mind-opening materials that cultivate critical thinking. Their job description includes teaching private classes to business professionals, teaching students in elementary schools in vulnerable districts, and creating and implementing a project within the communities that they serve. Beyond English seeks to create a social enterprise that influences the core characteristics in a global citizen; the curiosity in learning a language and social responsibility.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Lumni is a new kind of financial services company dedicated to ensuring that students everywhere can leverage their most valuable asset - their own future potential - to access financing for college. Unlike traditional student lenders, they fundamentally align the interest of their investors and students in a win-win relationship that benefits everyone. Lumni's investment funds don't make loans. Instead, students commit a fixed percentage of income for the 10 years after they graduate. This dramatically reduces the risk of unmanageable payments after graduation in the case of unemployment or underemployment, giving debt-averse, underserved college students the comfort to take a leap. Lumni also employs an innovative underwriting process, determining creditworthiness not on access to co-signer like traditional lenders, but instead on a student's personal drive and potential. This allows Lumni to identify qualified clients from with the country's most underserved populations, students who would be deemed too risky by private lenders. Finally, Lumni distinguishes itself by building a relationship with its students and supporting them with career coaching and development services.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Abramar is a multi-disciplinary real estate developer, pioneer of Social Urbanism, meeting rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, transparency and financial returns. The profitable, award winning company leads its markets by selling top-quality yet affordable housing to lower-middle income buyers while remaining a steward of the city and the environment. Abramar's projects are audited by Deloitte LLP, have received an A- credit rating from Austin Rating, obtained GERIC from Caixa and has credit lines with most major banks. Abramar is a frequent keynote speaker on such as events like "social entrepreneurship" (at the Beijing Forum), "happiness" (At Columbia University), "real estate development" (At REIW São Paulo) and "online business management" (At Google HQ), and has been featured in publications such as The Economist and Money Today. The team represents 6 nationalities, is 50% bi-lingual, 50% women, 70% practice sports regularly, and thanks to its low turnover tenure length averages 4 years. One fifth of the team is dedicated to intellectual property which allows Abramar to innovate technology and design for scalable positive impact in the neighborhoods it develops. We believe that value is measured not just in financial return but also social and environmental impact, so we wanted to be part of a community of companies that feel the same. The B Corp community is a step in the right direction of changing the conversation world wide on what value really is. We think that as part of the B Corp community we can broaden our reach to evolve the build world. The Change We Seek Over the next 20 years the world will construct enough housing that if we stacked it, it would equate to 5 buildings to the moon! The way we develop these 'moonscrapers' will influence our quality of life, consumption, energy usage, nature and the urban landscape. Through Social Urbanism we've created a method of high environmental and social standards that can improve the quality of life for thousands of families and future generations directly and indirectly not just in Brazil but any country.

text_snippet: QStone started in 2010 with the vision of bringing quality products closer to regular customers with an affordable budget. Nowadays the company employes over 50 people and has become a Certified B Corp, working with the biggest Developers and Construction Companies of Chile and expanding shortly into Peru. QStone imports, fabricates and installs Quartz Countertops, getting closely involved in the designing process of them in 'look' and technology. Recently, the company has opened a new product line, complementing its catalogue with modular cabinets for Kitchen, Bathrooms and Closets. We became a B Corp because we believe in bringing a positive Social-Environment Impact on our Community. Precisely, we give the opportunity for convicted felons to get back on their feet by working in our factory, learning new skills, proving themselves and giving them the opportunity to make a life change for them and their families. The Change We Seek The company seeks to contribute to the community by giving the opportunity for chronically underemployed communities (esp. convicted prison inmates) to learn new skills and work in its factory. QStone seeks also to contribute in lowering its emissions to the environment, in its manufacturing process.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: La Ciudad Posible is a collaborative working platform composed of professionals of different disciplines which develops double impact projects. In La Ciudad Posible the work is systematic and participatory, all of the projects articulate public and private areas, and are framed in the following ONU Sustainable Development Goals: • Make cities inclusive, safe, resilent and sustainable. • Ensure access to water and sanitation for all. • Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all. • Build resilient infrastructure, promote sustainable industrialization and foster innovation. • Ensure sustainable consumption and production patterns. • Take urgent action and combat climate change and its impact. • Sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, halt and reverse land degradation, halt biodiversity loss. La Ciudad Posible believes that the success relies in creating a business model that integrates the economic benefits with the impact in society and environment. La Ciudad Posible looks for concrete solutions to social and environmental issues in cities, creating at the same time added value for all groups of interest.

text_snippet: Glatt Stove born in 2013, is a company who's mission is to be the most economical, ecological and most efficient solution to change the lives of people who die from cooking with smoke. The star product is La Estufita (Little Stove) a resistant and portable stove that works with an ecological liquid fuel. As a multisegment product, Glatt Stove is targeting different markets. From the family in rural areas that still cooks with fuelwood or charcoal, to the builder that needs to live in the construction areas temporarily. La Estufita was designed so the fuel is used as efficiently as possible to give a real solution to these people. It only emits 7.5 ppm and doesn’t produce smoke. It started as an entrepreneurial project and now it has the infrastructure and the team to produce 10,000 stoves daily. It is expected to grow to 20,000 stoves per day and 100,000 liters per day. Thanks to the production process that it is based on, the industry can handle the fuel easily. Hence, the global demand can be satisfied easily.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: POLKURA is a wine growing project, started in 2002 by the Muoz and Bruchfeld families, with the purpose of making an exceptional wine, based on the exciting Syrah grape variety. Marchigue, the western end of the Colchagua Valley in Chile was chosen as the ideal site, for it has shown enormous potential to produce this varietal. POLKURA is the name of a little hill, located inside the vineyard. On its slopes grow the grapes which make this wine. POLKURA means ÒYellow StoneÓ in the native Chilean Mapuche language, making reference to large amounts of yellow granite spread along the clay soils of the area. Decomposed granite imparts the wine minerality and elegance, whereas clay gives it body and structure. The moderate coastal climate adds spice and fruitiness, resulting in a fine, yet complex and full bodied wine with very good balance.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Founded by a group of Mexican entrepreneurs headed by Francisco Vizcaya, FINAE is a social impact financial institution specialized in student loans in order to support Mexican students who do not have enough financial resources to pay for their undergraduate tuitions. FINAE provides the students a product that allows them to study in a qualified University at an affordable monthly payment. Once they start working, they are able to payback without having a high impact in their expected income. Founded in October 2006, FINAE grants its first student loans in November 2007. The idea of offering student loans emerged as a solution to the actual situation of public universities: every year, about 350,000 youngsters in age to attend college are not able to do it because public universities are overcrowded and they lack of resources to pay for a private university. There are 10 million students between 19 and 23 years old, of which only 3 million goes to college, that is to say, there are more than 7 million college-age youngsters who do not study, which is equivalent to almost the entire population of Switzerland, or the entire population of Chicago.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: The Farm "Mãe D'Água" is a property located at the south side of the state of Minas Gerais that associates traditional agricultural practices with Natural Organic Agriculture and Agroforestry and awareness of animal welfare. Currently it produces coffee and high quality milk and it has been investing in better social and environmental practices since the beginning of its operations in 2012. It has a total of 900 hectares and directly places 42 employees in "Conceição do Rio Verde" County - with a remuneration above the average in the region - following the principles of business profitability associated with the improvements in people’s quality of life in its community. Besides the social impact, the Farm also acts to promote environmental preservation, seeking to utilize low environmental impact technologies having already recovered 200 hectares of degraded areas by planting fruit trees, native species, among others. Acreditamos que cada negócio tem como objetivo, além da rentabilidade, melhorar a sociedade na qual está inserida, com benefícios concretos ao meio ambiente, colaboradores, consumidores e animais envolvidos, por isso optamos por fazer parte de um movimento de empresas que questiona a economia atual do lucro pelo lucro e se preocupa com seu papel na comunidade. The Change We Seek A Mae d´Água se posiciona como uma Fazenda de porte médio pioneira, ao aliar o manejo convencional à práticas de baixo impacto ambiental, além de trabalhar com uma política cooperativa e respeitosa para com os colaboradores, visando seu empoderamento pessoal e ascensão econômica. Através deste modus operandi, vem servindo de exemplo para outros produtores rurais médios e grandes, demonstrando viabilidade econômica, e incluindo no rol de importância o impacto social e ambiental. Desta forma, espera-se a longo prazo contribuir para uma mudança na mentalidade de produção do agronegócio brasileiro.

Maria Farinha Filmes also has other projects that involve research in children play, Brazilian culture, and activism that are being produced for TV, cinema and the Internet. Audiovisual content has shown itself to be a tool of extreme efficiency that possesses great potential power for transformation. Unfortunately, themes necessary to improve humanity are generally treated with less care than commercially driven ones. Also, in the making of Maria Farinha's films, sets are always functioning with social and environmental concerns in mind.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Faro Energy provides fully financed onsite solar systems to companies across Latin America. Faro's customers save on energy bills, reduce energy price volatility and increase independence from the grid. Faro's investors benefit from stable, long term returns on their investment. Faro Energy partners with a network of local engineers and developers across the region, bringing together the best local knowledge and engineering skills with international capital and solar expertise. Faro Energy was known as Iwana Energy until June 2016 Faro Energy aims to accelerate the transition to a low carbon economy, by bringing innovative solar financing models to new markets. In many emerging markets, solar is already cost-competitive with grid power without subsidy. However, most energy consumers (of all sizes) want to pay for their energy as they use it rather than incurring large upfront costs. This makes lack of access to capital is one of the biggest barriers to rapid roll-out of solar. Ultimately, Faro aims to catalyse a large scale shift in global capital flows to a low carbon economy, by creating attractive, large scale investment opportunities - turning clean energy infrastructure in developing countries into a mainstream investment asset.

text_snippet: Ematris is a consulting company based in Chile dedicated to boosting innovators and social, cultural and business entrepreneurs, through consulting, coaching and fundraising from private and public sources. Each part of the consulting process is designed to create learning experiences that enable entrepreneurs to strengthen their businesses. Ematris also employs young entrepreneurs in part-time jobs, so they can work with other projects, build networks, and create experiences of success in an environment of continuous development that they can apply in their own businesses. In Chile, 53% of microenterprises do not pass their first year of life, and the 0.3% that grow to be large are almost all technology-based. On the other hand, researchers from universities and other centers of excellence don't have the skills or time to transfer their developed technology to the market. Thus, support is necessary to provide tools to entrepreneurs in order for them to achieve success in their projects and to develop and create positive change in society.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: FRUANDES’ unique flavors are the result of an equally unique journey that starts in rural Colombia, where FRUANDES’ farmers live, harvest and select the best produce that gets delivered to FRUANDES’ distribution centers. All produce is transported and received in FRUANDES’ production plant in Bogota following strict quality standards. Once the fresh fruit reaches their facilities, they carefully analyze and select each piece according to its ripeness. After this, each fruit undergoes a washing and disinfection phase, which is followed by the fruit-specific peeling, cutting, dehydration and final quality control & packaging process. Organic Dried Mango, Organic Dried Physalis, Dried Pineapple, Dried Dragon Fruit, Organic Dried Baby Banana - and our specials Organic Whole Sugar Cane and Organic Cocoa Nibs - are therefore, the result of a delicate manual processing, which magically translates into an unforgettable flavor that resembles the Colombian Andes and the caring work performed by every individual involved in the process.

text_snippet: Parque del Recuerdo is the first cemetery in Chile that utilizes a novel concept of landscaping in their services. Over the past 40 years, Parque del Recuerdo has helped families cope with the loss of a loved one. They are committed to provide professional support to those who need it. In the past five years, they have carried out the only existing study about Chilean culture and death. The results have been shared in the community, and they have addressed their strategies based on the needs of individuals, diversifying, for example rites and memorial services. Since its creation, Parque del Recuerdo has become a popular green space in Santiago- which is one of the world's top ten polluted cities. The gardens are one of the many attractions to the cemetery where you can find every kind of flora and fauna. Parque del Recuerdo spans over 452.2 acres, and it is one of the few resting places for migratory birds.

text_snippet: The Hiptipico name is derived from the Spanish word, “tipico,” which is the traditional clothing that indigenous Mayans wear in Guatemala. Incorporating the local word "tipico" into our name and using it as the basis of our brand, reinforces that we are truly dedicated to promoting traditional designs authentic to the Mayan people in the highlands of Guatemala. Hiptipico’s mission is to create a sustainable avenue for high quality, artisan-level products to reach the global fashion marketplace. Our goal is to support the creativity, ingenuity and passion of these local artisans in Guatemala while preserving Mayan culture and traditions. Hiptipico honors the Mayan culture, motivates local entrepreneurial spirits and empowers families and communities. Every Hiptipico item is thoughtfully handcrafted by indigenous communities, using high-quality sustainable materials.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Caos! comunicação & design is a creative studio that develops solutions in the areas of multiplatform communication and information design, in the search for results that can facilitate and broaden the range of transforming ideas and actions. With 10 years of experience in the market and relying on a multidisciplinary team, caos! has created complex projects for major brands, from strategy to implementation, always using design as a tool that allow the comprehension of the whole, not losing attention to details. Believing in construction of networks, in exchange and in experience as promoters of knowledge, in the open source as an important mindset for transformation, caos! has been implementing actions and promoting ideas through their own projects. BRIO 2013, a national award for digital projects. Convescote, an open event of talks that happens every month with more than 70 editions held. Engenhoca, a lab for experimentation where the following projects where developed: galeria caos!, cromatográfico, B facts, egotweet and video:sprints. In order to guide and evaluate it’s projects, caos! defined the following positive impact drivers: sustainability, transformation and legacy. These drivers translate objectively the focus and purpose of the studio and help to guide and review processes and objectives. Each driver is assessed according to the following criteria: reach, impact and duration. This creates metrics that can be compared over time and generates information that can be shared clearly. Through the B Corp community, we found a network of people and companies that share ideas, ideals and values which have driven us for many years. It also brings new perspectives and practices to our own way of acting. The Change We Seek In a world where mass culture and global marketing create desires and subjectivities, where information is treated as a commodity and people as variables in algorithms, caos! believe in design as a promoter of a human-centered vision. Collaboration can contribute to building more truthful, responsible and transparent practices. In the quest to be one of the agents of this new movement, the studio seeks, through the establishment of interdependent local networks, to participate in and promote actions aligned with the ideas of new education, maker culture, open source, new production and distribution arrangements and organisms. Evoe!

Based in the heart of San Francisco’s dynamic tech scene, Colibri Digital Marketing is a forward-thinking, woman-owned, and certified LGBTBE agency focused on the triple bottom line of people, planet, and profit. Marketing by its nature stimulates consumerism, and for that reason Colibri Digital Marketing seeks to set a values-based industry standard that motivates clients and colleagues to use their power as business owners, brands, and influencers to create a socially and environmentally sustainable present and future. title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Established in 1979, Mãe Terra has always believed that a natural diet consisting of foods that are closer to nature, is a key to a healthier and more balanced life. To ensure that they stay on track and that all products be truly natural, they follow the Mãe Terra 7 principles: foods that are trully whole, less processed; organic whenever possible; with ingredients that value the Brazilian biodiversity; favoring local and family farmers; free of chemical additives and GMOs and, of course, very tasty. Mãe Terra faces the challenge of growing, though within the limits of nature, valuing the environmental preservation and social care. They enjoy the privilege of being born in a country of rich biodiversity, Brazil, which in turn, allows them to experience and value ingredients that were historically underutilized by the food industry. The appreciation of the Brazilian biodiversity opens many opportunities, but also puts more responsibility on our shoulders, for they have to consider the use of sustainable resources. Offering access to natural and organic products, caring for people and the planet, is our way to validate the belief that the company should continue operating in an economically sustainable manner.

text_snippet: Karün is a Chilean B corporation that offers sustainable and high-quality eyewear designed to last. Through its Karün Regeneration Model, the brand demonstrates that companies can be a tool for social and environmental well-being. Karün's products are made with recycled and traceable materials, collected in collaboration with local rural communities in Patagonia to restore natural ecosystems and regenerate local economies. In addition to its commitment to sustainability, Karun is a pioneer in transparency by providing information on the carbon emissions of each product and allowing customers to track the production process through its Karun Traceability System, powered by blockchain technology. Today, the brand is present in more than 17 countries worldwide and has been recognized by leading sustainability organizations such as MIDO, National Geographic, and Forbes. Learn more about the brand at karuneyewear.com.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Santiago Peralta, founder of the company, is a man with a mission: to change the history of chocolate in his native country. In less than four years, the company, a family-owned business operated by Peralta and his wife Carla Barbotó, has revolutionized the industry in both Ecuador and Latin America by creating a transparent model of tree-to-bar manufacturing based on innovation, ecological and social responsibility, and direct trade with certified organic farms throughout the country. Peralta and his company benefit more than 3,500 farming families. “We are intimately connected to cacao farmers and their needs, and we work with them in many important ways: to help them improve cacao yields, in implementing programs of organic and biodynamic certification, even creating a school of organic agriculture (COLEGIO CEFA),” Peralta explains. “Sometimes our help might seem intangible like buying donkeys for a disabled farmer to ease his work load, or reducing the weight of cacao bags so that women can carry these bags more easily to local markets, but these small things also matter and are proof of our commitment to a direct model of interaction that puts the farmer first.”

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: CajaVecina is a Company that allows Chile to be a more inclusive country, by offering financial opportunities to those who don’t have access. They provide financial and non-financial solutions, that improve in a significant way, the quality of life of the people residing in their country. Before their founding, people from isolated communities needed to travel long distances and spend a significant amount of their earnings to run a small errand. They are now in every small town, city, and region of Chile making a significant change in the lives of the Chilean population. CajaVecina was founded with the goal of offering an innovative system that provides financial and non-financial solutions. However, their mission has always been more than that. They are a company that seeks to connect and to improve the lives of many who didn’t have a choice when it came to everyday errands, so insignificant to many but very important to others (the elderly, people in isolated and vulnerable communities, and people in cities with high population).

text_snippet: YUXTA Energy is a growing and global Certified B Corporation, which started in Costa Rica by using business as a force for good. Their decisions are based on People, Planet & Profit. As a signatory of the UN Global Compact, YUXTA Energy develops and collaborates on business models that enable the achievement of the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDG). Their work has been focused on SDG #7, ensuring access to affordable, reliable and modern energy for all, mainly in America, but recently expanding to other goals and other regions around the world. Depending on the market needs, they provide solutions on Renewable Energy, Energy Efficiency, Electric Transportation, Smart Metering and Data Services. Costa Rica runs on 98% renewable electricity. They will work with you to do the same in your country, for the benefit of the world.

text_snippet: Donadora is a Mexican crowdfunding platform through which you can raise funds to support personal or social projects such as health campaigns, emergencies, community and environmental projects, volunteering, educational models, etc. The term "crowd" is related to "multitude" or "many people", while "funding" refers to financing. So the term crowdfunding has been born to describe a collective financing model, where many people finance a campaign through small or large contributions. This is a new and different form of philanthropy that seeks to use technology for the benefit of social and personal purposes. These platforms were created with the aim of supporting millions of human needs which are sometimes seen very distant due to lack of economic resources. Donadora believes in removing these barriers, so everyone can play a part in initiatives with great heart and big impact. Donadora is the Crowdfunding's platform within your reach!

text_snippet: Organicos Brita produces fresh and frozen organic fruit and berries, jams, marmelades, juices and pastries from their own orchard. They also incorporate small disadvantaged growers into their value chain by purchasing, at fair conditions, fruits and other products from such vendors. They use solar energy in all their processes. The company sells its products in their coffee shop, in specialized business around Chile and in fair trade shops in Europe. Because we were purpose driven, we also liked the B Impact Assessment and redefinition of performance measures. We believe firmly that together as B corporations, we are able to achieve more and better benefits for society and environment on a global scale.The Change We Seek The company's purpose is to create sustainable jobs and additional income for small disadvantaged farmers in Pinto, a poor rural county in Chile. This contribution to the local economy helps to avoid migration into big cities like Santiago and all the social problems related to such migration. By giving people a reason to stay, Organicos Brita not only improves the local economy and culture, but also provides a solution to social and environmental issues.

text_snippet: Bodhi Surf + Yoga is a surf and yoga camp located in Bahia Ballena, Osa, Costa Rica — a small, still relatively untouched community on the Southern Pacific Zone of the country. It is located at the footsteps of the Marino Ballena National Park, a place where the jungle, ocean, and mountains meet; a unique backdrop for a place to immerse yourself in nature, recharge, become energized, and “awaken your inner surfer”. As a tourism-based business, Bodhi Surf + Yoga strives to provide its guests with holistic and unique travel experiences that promote responsible tourism, facilitate community engagement, and encourage individuals to see the world (and their role in it!) with fresh eyes. As a surf and yoga camp, Bodhi Surf + Yoga provides its guests with fun, challenging experiences that teach them the necessary skills that will allow them to go forth and continue practicing these activities independently. As a follower and supporter of the neuro-conservation movement, Bodhi Surf + Yoga utilizes surfing and yoga as a way to facilitate unforgettable learning experiences in nature with the intention of bolstering individual long-term action.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: ChiloteShoes is a platform that enables the co-creation, crafting and distribution of eco-inclusive, ethical footwear for conscious consumers worldwide. Founded in 2010, the ChiloteShoes mission is to develop sustainable footwear whilst empowering independent makers and artisans. Their first product, is a multiple award winning wool slipper that is hand made in Patagonia through a coop system of ethical production. There is no factory so each pair is made “slow” with care and pride by independent artisan women doing what they know & love – knitting. The slippers are made of only two materials, sheep wool and up-cycled salmon leather both local renewable materials sourced in Patagonia. They seek to support highly vulnerable artisan women in rural Patagonia, empower women to generate an ethical income doing what they love from home, and sustain a unique culture and heritage.

text_snippet: TQV is one of the first sustainable hair salons in Chile. They offer their clients a safer salon service using products that have no parabens or harmful chemicals like amonia and phormol. They also make sure that their product's formulas have more natural and organic ingredients and that none of them are tested on animals or come from them (only bee wax, eggs and milk). They also try to create a more sustainable service saving water and energy using special showers and solar energy. In this way, they have created a better environment for their costumers and also for the people that work in the salon. TQV would like to change the way things are done in the beauty salon industry in Chile. With their example they want to prove that, with a little effort, things can be better: you can support your workers, you can use better products and you can have a better environment inside your salon with less toxic chemicals and with better team relationships.

Tenemos un equipo multidisciplinario en cinco áreas de especialidad -comunicaciones, publicidad, digital, branding y crisis-, que pueden ayudar a resolver los desafíos de tu negocio y lograr resultados extraordinarios. Simplicity cuenta con oficinas propias en Estados Unidos y Chile, cinco socios y un staff de más de 40 profesionales. Además, tiene una red de agencias de partners estratégicos en Nueva York, México, Colombia, Perú, Ecuador, Argentina y Uruguay, quienes entregan la mejor experiencia local para contribuir a que los clientes ejecuten con éxito programas de comunicación y marketing a nivel local o regional. Nos apasiona trabajar con personas que sueñan en grande y defienden sus ideas. En Simplicity, nos hacemos cargo.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Avante is empowering the massive underserved sector of micro-entrepreneurs across Brazil, by providing them an advanced suite of FinTech services. Its disruptive combination of Credit, Insurance and Payments makes it the largest MFI in Brazil, spearheading impact by technology and Innovation. As +40 million micro-businesses continue to be underserved by the financial industry, Avante is focusing on providing a micro-finance one-stop-shop to businesses operating in "the base of the pyramid". The company's grand mission is to humanize financial services to audiences suffering from Financial Exclusion. With over R$200 million in concession, Avante is impacting the lives of tens of thousands of individuals and their families suffering from financial exclusion, rapidly gearing with new technologies and disrupting Brazil's financial landscape. Its combination of Credit, Insurance and Payments, offer a ground-breaking approach to class E/D businesses, certifying the company as a B Corporation and 2018 B Corp Best for the World honoree. Headquartered in São Paulo with its Innovation Lab established in Tel-Aviv, the company is one of the fastest growing Brazilian financial organizations, employing 200 people.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Through sustainable manufacturing, Kruz offers real furniture.1. First, Kruz selects the noble woods that are most abundant in the south of Chile and that at the same time, meet the necessary aesthetic and resistance characteristics. Among them are the Mañio, Raulí, Lenga and Aromo.2. Then, Kruz creates simple and functional lines that do not go out of fashion. Despite using a valuable material, Kruz manages to have competitive prices, since they look to simplify the production process and to take advantage of every centimeter of wood.3. Kruz manufactures sustainable and timeless furniture, since this material has a low environmental cost and is an ecological product: Renewable, recyclable and biodegradable. (Unlike most of the furniture found today in the market, where companies have prioritized reducing costs sacrificing quality and the environment, using elements that pretend to be wood, such as melanin, which have a very short life, quickly becoming non-recyclable waste).4. After manufacturing the furniture, Kruz re-uses each piece of wood by giving it a second life, this is where the Toca Madera product line is born.

text_snippet: El Viaje de Odiseo is a multidisciplinary team that investigates the potential of social networking related to communication, knowledge management and collaborative work. Since 2005, Odiseo has been creating collaborative platforms for companies and institutions to enable actors to engage and interact together in the design of solutions for a sustainable future. Its mission is to build and manage intelligent networks, which, empowered with internet tools and technology, allow stakeholders to develop new models of socialization, productivity and business organization in order to effectively address our current planetary challenges. Odiseo believes that the adoption of new collaborative networks and its impact in organizations implies new structures of collaboration and governance. This is why the company has developed a methodology for implementing and managing collaborative networks, which also involves guiding organizations during the adoption process. Odiseo is confident that the changes that are generated by networking are directly linked to improving the quality of human relationships and caring for the planet.

It is a certified “blue economy” company, established with the aim of altering the way in which production processes are usually run and tackling resulting environmental problems, shifting from the use of rare and high-energy-cost resources to solutions based on simpler and cleaner technologies. text_snippet: Alcagüete is a company that believes that everything is better when shared which is why it designs products to promote sharing and wellbeing. Alcagüete's purpose is to create consciousness in society and build a whole movement in order to help people to share the good things with others. text_snippet: Geco is a Think & Do company that is focused on unlocking the potential businesses have to achieve local sustainable development. They do this with two ways. The first is co-creating with their clients the community strategies and relation programs in place. Geco works on initiatives that create trust to build associative and collaborative relationships; develop opportunities to maximize the positive impact of business by promoting local development, and manage social investment through sustainable projects and social impact. The second course is through developing GeCo projects and partnership initiatives that add value for all the involved parts by incorporating the base of the pyramid to the business value chain. One example of this is the case of the development of a maqui nectar "Newen Maqui " that was implemented with local harvesting communities, private companies, and the public sector. Today this is a product that, in addition to be beneficial to the environment and consumers, returns part of the profitability to communities. For more information, visit www.newenmaqui.cl.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Inka Moss is a Peruvian social enterprise - awarded by the Dutch Bid Network in 2009 - that exports sphagnum moss in a sustainable and eco-friendly way. White moss (sphagnum moss) is a wild plant that grows naturally at more than 3,500 meters above sea level in the Peruvian Andes. The final product is 100% organic and has the capacity to absorb 20 times its weight in water. It's also a natural antibacterial and an efficient heavy metals absorbent. It's mostly used as substrate in horticulture, especially in orchid cultivation, but also has multiple other applications such as subtract for green walls, hydroponic crops, topiaries or as water purifier. There is a high international demand for white moss especially in Asia, Europe and America and Inka Moss currently possesses 2% of the market share. Inka Moss achieves its mission by creating high social impact and insuring responsible treatment of the environment in the highlands of Peru. Indeed, by involving, since 2009, Andean communities in situations of extreme poverty as the fundamental link of its value chain, the company has been building an empowering, sustainable and eco-friendly model of business.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Qero fights against the environmental scourge of disposable cups by replacing them for reusable ones. The ultimate goal of Qero is to help provoke a cultural change by making people aware of the harmful effects of using disposable items, focusing on communication, high quality products and great service. Qero handles a 360® scope of the business, from the production of cups, washing and drying services, assessment in communication and calculation of environmental impact metrics, and finally the recycling of damaged cups (less than 1%) into other sustainable products such as portable trash cans or bike mudguards. Qero's main customers are festivals, beverage companies, artisan beer brewers, corporate and state offices, all of which have embraced the habit of reusing. In the first 4 years since its birth, the company has been able to avoid the use of 50 million disposable cups, which represent 800 tons of plastic waste and 3.000 tons of CO2 emissions.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Maggacup Argentina is the first company dedicated to the production and sale of the menstrual cup, an innovative and sustainable product Women period. The menstrual cup is a healthy friendly option for their reusable quality, environmental and cost savings. It is produced with hypoallergenic medical grade silicone, brought from Germany. With its use, deforestation and waste generation caused by other options, such as tampons and towels, they are fully avoid. Our goal is to empower women through sound management period. Positive environmental impact: The use of the menstrual cup would save 132,000 tons of non-recyclable waste. From 2013 to 2015, 12,000 cups Maggacup leads sold and avoided 85 million pathological waste menstrual hygiene. In March 2014, Maggacup signed an agreement with the NGO Forest Bank, with the commitment that each mug sold Ong donate to an amount equivalent to 1m2 of the missionary forest. In addition, use of the menstrual cup reduces carbon footprint is also reduced in buying imported menstrual cups. Positive impact social / community: There are women who do not have access to the financial means to stock up on cosmetics. They also lack access to toilets where they can be changed in suitably hygienic conditions and privacy. They are women who use what they have on hand, tea, cotton or mud. About 60% of these women believed that menstrual blood is harmful substances and that his greatest fear is smeared during menstruation, we can infer that the lack of information and embarrassment about menstruation go hand in hand. Positive impact on people: Maggacup already has more than 12 thousand users of menstrual cup. Its use provides several benefits:Care about women (The conventional feminine hygiene products have chemicals that are used for perfuming them, preserve them and blanch).Helps your personal economy (Investment spending on the purchase of the product pays for itself in about 10 months implying a saving of 400% over the annual budget of menstrual pads and tampons.Practicality and comfort.Promotes and requires the entry of the vagina in the body schema and manipulation of menstruation. At the organizational level, the social marketing company Maggacup began betting on relationships and empowerment, so has focused on the development of the initiators of channel and 150 women are more than willing to spread their experience, convey the value and sell the drink in their own community. Maggacup is important to strengthen membership in the community, also improving their personal and family finances ally. We believe that the initiators also as agents of change in their community where they generate a positive transformation. Under the World Day of menstrual hygiene initiative of German NGOs United Wash, with the aim of publicizing the fundamentals of menstrual hygiene in the economy, health, education, environment and human rights; Maggacup from an activity performed in public roads, in the interest of advancing the cause At first launch of the business, we have taken significant discounts, which then planned climb. In turn, from the marketing approach, we have all possible marketing channels. Maggacup has four business lines:The network of resellers: We are committed to the relationship and the empowerment of women so we work with a network of retail selling.Local network / Business: Marketed health products, organic, environmental, etc.Health Network: Maggacup seeks to develop a chain of health professionals to recommend the use of menstrual cup to their patients.E- Commerce: offer to buy the menstrual cup through digital media, as a way of bringing options in marketing the product. Our dissemination strategy and advertising is based on advertising to focus on BTL (bellow the line), media and digital networks that are supported by lower costs. In addition, to establish from the institutional area networks strategic partners with nonprofit organizations, private companies and civil society concerning. Convinced that our nature and essence perfectly match with the B Corporation, we worked for 6 months and got 108 points of 200 in the application process. We are part of the B Corporation Net, since November 2014. The Change We Seek We consider Maggacup as the arrowhead of women and humanity empowerment, through the healthy manage and interaction with our own body. It has impact in three levels: individual, community and humanity. Individually speaking, it impacts positivily in the self-esteem, in the sexual and reproductive health, resulting in the woman²s empowerment. At the comunity level, the effect of individual empowerment, is families and insititutions empowerment; and active citizen participation bio-social-educational. And because of the preservation and restitution of the environment, we get the humanity empowerment (ex: Girl Effect, www.girleffect.org). Magga means "way in the middle" and it is our mantra. We are a social and economic company and both aspects have the same value for us and are permanently interacting and balancing. While the menstrual cup is starting to have the largest circulation in Argentina, most women are using pads and tampons. Argentina In a year generates 3.38 billion units in wipes and tampons. They are products with very short shelf life and are pathogenic wastes that are not treatable or recyclable by waste collection systems. They are hazardous materials because they can be infected with infectious diseases. Furthermore, the raw material for the production of wipes and pads is Kraft pulp or fluff pulp involving 60% of the weight of these methods. Produced from the monoculture of exotic trees. Which it is associated with harmful effects on soil, waterways, vegetation and native fauna. In conclusion, consumption of wipes and tampons mean consumption of the planet's resources and degradation.The INTI (National Institute of Industrial Technology) tested for health fitness of the raw material used to manufacture according to the criteria and standards of the European Pharmacopoeia.The Faculty of Pharmacy and Biochemistry of the UBA (University of Buenos Aires) conducted testings of skin irritation.The industrial design of Maggacup is patented and registered with the INPI (National Institute of Industrial Property).Maggacup is registered in the National Administration of Drugs, Food and Medical Technology (ANMAT).

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Lumni is a new kind of financial services company dedicated to ensuring that students everywhere can leverage their most valuable asset - their own future potential - to access financing for college. Unlike traditional student lenders, they fundamentally align the interest of their investors and students in a win-win relationship that benefits everyone. Lumni's investment funds don't make loans. Instead, students commit a fixed percentage of income for the 10 years after they graduate. This dramatically reduces the risk of unmanageable payments after graduation in the case of unemployment or underemployment, giving debt-averse, underserved college students the comfort to take a leap. Lumni also employs an innovative underwriting process, determining creditworthiness not on access to co-signer like traditional lenders, but instead on a student's personal drive and potential. This allows Lumni to identify qualified clients from with the country's most underserved populations, students who would be deemed too risky by private lenders. Finally, Lumni distinguishes itself by building a relationship with its students and supporting them with career coaching and development services.

text_snippet: Accion Verde is a Colombian for profit enterprise that obtains revenues by producing positive social and environmental impacts, by planting trees in strategic places of Colombia, calling on third party Social Responsibility resources. Accion Verde's founder has been involved in sustainable development, associating my two careers, Economics and Anthropology since the beginning of his professional career. Accion Verde believes that the basis for a more just society, with people and the Planet, must include generating employment, entrepreneurship, with economic benefits for owners as well as collaborators. This social/environmental thrust for sustainable and just development, motivated their team to become a B Corporation. Accion Verde strives to generate ecological restoration in strategic places of Colombia, prevent natural disasters while mitigating climate change. They hope to create a new society, more inclusive and in tune with the protection of the environment, that will help improve the basis for Colombian and Planetary sustainable development. Each person, each enterprise must and should, do a green action (Acción Verde), and Accion Verde offers them that possibility with protective reforestation.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: La Ciudad Posible is a collaborative working platform composed of professionals of different disciplines which develops double impact projects. In La Ciudad Posible the work is systematic and participatory, all of the projects articulate public and private areas, and are framed in the following ONU Sustainable Development Goals: • Make cities inclusive, safe, resilent and sustainable. • Ensure access to water and sanitation for all. • Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all. • Build resilient infrastructure, promote sustainable industrialization and foster innovation. • Ensure sustainable consumption and production patterns. • Take urgent action and combat climate change and its impact. • Sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, halt and reverse land degradation, halt biodiversity loss. La Ciudad Posible believes that the success relies in creating a business model that integrates the economic benefits with the impact in society and environment. La Ciudad Posible looks for concrete solutions to social and environmental issues in cities, creating at the same time added value for all groups of interest.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Beyond English is a social enterprise based in Santiago, Chile that uses English as a tool to empower global citizens while providing equal access to educational opportunities. They do this through the Beyond English Model that deliberately works towards solving three important problems: the lack of English proficiency among Chilean professionals and executives, educational exclusion in Chile, and the lack of meaningful international opportunities that offer a balance of intrinsic and extrinsic motivators. At Beyond English, they solve these problems by integrating them into one holistic approach. Beyond English's team of passionate globally minded Teaching Fellows go beyond just a normal English class by using mind-opening materials that cultivate critical thinking. Their job description includes teaching private classes to business professionals, teaching students in elementary schools in vulnerable districts, and creating and implementing a project within the communities that they serve. Beyond English seeks to create a social enterprise that influences the core characteristics in a global citizen; the curiosity in learning a language and social responsibility.

text_snippet: Hello there! We're Awto, the leading car-sharing platform in Chile and Brazil, born from a dream in 2016. Our founders, a group of innovative entrepreneurs, envisioned cities free of pollution and road congestion. Equipped with one powerful idea and the support of a team with diverse experience, they launched the first car-sharing service in Chile. Fast forward to today, and we're proud to have grown our operation to 1,500 connected vehicles across Chile and Brazil. Our mission remains rooted in creating sustainable and efficient urban mobility solutions. By offering a hassle-free, cost-effective alternative to car ownership, we're helping shape greener, less-congested cities, one ride at a time. Our story is only just beginning. We're excited to continue our journey, contributing to cleaner, smarter cities for us all. Stay tuned for the ride!

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Tonka SA is a family owned company with 80 employees. They are an Argentine metallurgical company that develops and fabricates gas controls for household gas appliances. Innovation is a way of living for them. The company started 46 years ago with an innovation and Tonka SA has been doing so for all these years. They design and create security and control devices for instant water heaters, stoves, heaters and many other appliances. Due to existing public policies, fossil energies have been very cheap for the last decades. For this reason there is no culture for the rational use of these natural resources. In the last year, conditions changed and natural gas became very expensive due to importations at international prices. With Tonka SAÕs innovation policies and strong research and development position, their company supplies the local industry with the necessary products needed to save gas and promote the essential use of it. Tonka SA deals with energy. They hope to help society use it well in order to save natural resources. Environment and society needs to be taken into consideration when providing the industry that creates gas appliances. Tonka SAÕs mission as a company is not only oriented around saving energy, but also seeking to promote the common good within society.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: CajaVecina is a Company that allows Chile to be a more inclusive country, by offering financial opportunities to those who don’t have access. They provide financial and non-financial solutions, that improve in a significant way, the quality of life of the people residing in their country. Before their founding, people from isolated communities needed to travel long distances and spend a significant amount of their earnings to run a small errand. They are now in every small town, city, and region of Chile making a significant change in the lives of the Chilean population. CajaVecina was founded with the goal of offering an innovative system that provides financial and non-financial solutions. However, their mission has always been more than that. They are a company that seeks to connect and to improve the lives of many who didn’t have a choice when it came to everyday errands, so insignificant to many but very important to others (the elderly, people in isolated and vulnerable communities, and people in cities with high population).

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Glatt Stove born in 2013, is a company who's mission is to be the most economical, ecological and most efficient solution to change the lives of people who die from cooking with smoke. The star product is La Estufita (Little Stove) a resistant and portable stove that works with an ecological liquid fuel. As a multisegment product, Glatt Stove is targeting different markets. From the family in rural areas that still cooks with fuelwood or charcoal, to the builder that needs to live in the construction areas temporarily. La Estufita was designed so the fuel is used as efficiently as possible to give a real solution to these people. It only emits 7.5 ppm and doesn’t produce smoke. It started as an entrepreneurial project and now it has the infrastructure and the team to produce 10,000 stoves daily. It is expected to grow to 20,000 stoves per day and 100,000 liters per day. Thanks to the production process that it is based on, the industry can handle the fuel easily. Hence, the global demand can be satisfied easily.

O trabalho da PARES integra a inteligência e ações de stakeholders internos e externos na construção de soluções para os desafios de gestão e desenvolvimento organizacional. Su creación se realizó con el objetivo de facilitar la relación de Cafexport SARL y sus clientes en Europa con los productores de café en Colombia. Cafexport, esta comprometido con la creación de relaciones largas y estables con nuestros clientes, lo que permite fortalecer la cadena de valor del café y generar prosperidad para nuestros productores y nuestras comunidades. Acompañamos a agricultores y cooperativas en sus procesos de mejoramiento continuo, a través de asistencia técnica, programas y proyectos tanto técnicos, como sociales y ambientales. Operamos bajo la guía de diferentes estándares de Sostenibilidad y Cadena de Custodia, como son las certificaciones UTZ, Rainforest Alliance, FLO y ORGÁNICO y las verificaciones C.A.F.E. Practices, AAA Sustainable Quality Program y Nestlé Responsible Sourcing Standard. Además, estamos comprometidos con los requisitos internacionales definidos por la FDA en cuanto a la inocuidad de los alimentos.

text_snippet: Somos uma empresa de consultoria de projetos socioambientais com sede no Rio de Janeiro-RJ. Desde 2013, conectamos o conhecimento local e global para o desenvolvimento sustentável, criando um grande portfólio de projetos em diferentes temas, como mitigação e adaptação às mudanças climáticas, proteção e uso sustentável do ecossistema e o bem-estar da comunidade. Dentro de nossos projetos, oferecemos diferentes tipos de serviços, que incluem análises técnicas, fortalecimento institucional, ferramentas de desenho, entre outros. Possuímos uma rede diversificada de profissionais qualificados, que nos permitem fornecer análises técnicas sobre diferentes assuntos, desde conservação de florestas a mobilidade urbana e contas nacionais. Nós também oferecemos serviços de fortalecimento institucional, por meio de oficinas, capacitações, desenhos e implementação de ações para melhorar a administração integrada, a administração financeira, e a efetividade da cooperação entre múltiplas partes interessadas. Complementar a estas atividades, desenvolvemos e auxiliamos na apropriação de ferramentas econômicas e de gestão para sistematizar, analisar e integrar dados, o que simplifica os processos de gestão, a gestão do conhecimento, a interoperabilidade dos sistemas e a transparência da informação.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: POLKURA is a wine growing project, started in 2002 by the Muoz and Bruchfeld families, with the purpose of making an exceptional wine, based on the exciting Syrah grape variety. Marchigue, the western end of the Colchagua Valley in Chile was chosen as the ideal site, for it has shown enormous potential to produce this varietal. POLKURA is the name of a little hill, located inside the vineyard. On its slopes grow the grapes which make this wine. POLKURA means ÒYellow StoneÓ in the native Chilean Mapuche language, making reference to large amounts of yellow granite spread along the clay soils of the area. Decomposed granite imparts the wine minerality and elegance, whereas clay gives it body and structure. The moderate coastal climate adds spice and fruitiness, resulting in a fine, yet complex and full bodied wine with very good balance.

Ematris also employs young entrepreneurs in part-time jobs, so they can work with other projects, build networks, and create experiences of success in an environment of continuous development that they can apply in their own businesses. In Chile, 53% of microenterprises do not pass their first year of life, and the 0.3% that grow to be large are almost all technology-based. On the other hand, researchers from universities and other centers of excellence don't have the skills or time to transfer their developed technology to the market. Thus, support is necessary to provide tools to entrepreneurs in order for them to achieve success in their projects and to develop and create positive change in society.

Users as well receive notifications on the mobile app or receive calls from the call center to remind them of their appointment. HoraSalud is simple and user friendly. It is a powerful tool to support health centers because it helps them to reduce the number of missed appoitments because of people’s absence, HoraSalud is making possible to cancel the appointment before hand, this way the now available appointment will be offered to someone else that may need it. This system integrates Artificial Intelligence to administrate the appointments in order to offer them to the people who need it the most instead of the first person who calls. title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: Faro Energy provides fully financed onsite solar systems to companies across Latin America. Faro's customers save on energy bills, reduce energy price volatility and increase independence from the grid. Faro's investors benefit from stable, long term returns on their investment. Faro Energy partners with a network of local engineers and developers across the region, bringing together the best local knowledge and engineering skills with international capital and solar expertise. Faro Energy was known as Iwana Energy until June 2016 Faro Energy aims to accelerate the transition to a low carbon economy, by bringing innovative solar financing models to new markets. In many emerging markets, solar is already cost-competitive with grid power without subsidy. However, most energy consumers (of all sizes) want to pay for their energy as they use it rather than incurring large upfront costs. This makes lack of access to capital is one of the biggest barriers to rapid roll-out of solar. Ultimately, Faro aims to catalyse a large scale shift in global capital flows to a low carbon economy, by creating attractive, large scale investment opportunities - turning clean energy infrastructure in developing countries into a mainstream investment asset.

title: Certificación B Corp
text_snippet: In the first half of 2018 they were certified by B Lab as a B Corp. To obtain certification, Almonds of Brazil was the result of a series of associated assessments in actions of Governance, Workers, Environment and Community. Since they have had a clear vision of their role as a change agent both in the workplace and in their community since their foundation, their actions were within the B Corp certifications. As a combination of profit with the solution of social and environmental problems, both in welfare measures and a mission plan to follow, they offer their employees a wide range of health care and educational and sports programs focused on quality of life and development. In this way, they do not measure resources to make sure that, in addition to high quality products, they make people happy and a community that supports and values ​​the company's activities. They are committed to showing the world that they can be agents of change and contribute to the solution of the great social and environmental problems. For this and other reasons, they are part of a global movement, they are a B Corp. No primeiro semestre de 2018 fomos certificados pela B Lab como Empresa B. Para obter a certificação, a Amêndoas do Brasil decorreu de uma série de avaliações associadas em ações das áreas da Governança, Trabalhadores, Meio Ambiente e Comunidade. Como temos, desde a nossa fundação, uma visão clara do nosso papel como um agente de mudança, tanto no local de trabalho como na nossa comunidade, nossas ações estavam dentro das certificações concedidas pelo B Lab. Como combinação de lucro com a solução de problemas sociais e ambientais, tanto em medidas de previdências como um plano de missão a seguir, nós oferecemos aos colaboradores da nossa empresa uma ampla assistência à saúde e programas educativos e esportivos voltados a qualidade de vida e desenvolvimento. Dessa maneira, não medimos recursos para nos certificar de que, além de produtos de alta qualidade, fazemos as pessoas felizes e uma comunidade que apoia e valoriza as atividades da empresa. Temos o compromisso de mostrar ao mundo que podemos ser agentes de mudança e contribuir para a solução dos grandes problemas sociais e ambientas. Por essa e outras razões, somos parte de um movimento global, somos uma Empresa B.
